short_d: Comes as described, def made in China though
content: Despite a reply to the contrary, these are rather obviously marked "made in China"- both the box and there is a sticker inside the guitar. It did come with everything noted in description, and looks like it will perhaps serve the purpose intended (my 5 yo wants to learn to play "guitar") Sadly, one cannot trust the Google Q&A because someone told me this was made in USA (HI). Ehhh, nope. The strings are thick fishing line material, it is hard to tell from pic/description. This was a purchase for a child who may lose interest after a short time, so I am ok with it. However, had this been intended for anyone 11+ I'd be nope, nope, nope....Not a homer, but C19 has me like-- buy something that will last, buy something better, buy USA. We will keep this, because we can upgrade if there is legitimate interest, but I wouldn't be shocked if you found something similar at 5Below at some point.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
short_d: Starter uke I would order again
content: I am no eike expert but I love this!!!! I decided to buy a uke and learn to play an instrument during this crazy quarantine. Knowing nothing about them I found one that looked cute and came with everything I needed. Here we are a few days later and I am playing rip tide and my 6 year old son is mastering A minor and C cords. This uke is definitely entry level. I would suggest it for kids and a tester to see if you would like to play. I am already ordering a new euk for myself one in a concert size. However I am so happy to have this as my first uke so my son and I can learn this instrument together!!!! It is taking a while for it to hold its tuning, but this is true for all ukes. If I had to start over with my eukalele purchase I would definitely order it again. That being said it is low end but for the price you get everything you need and Im happy to have started my euke collection with such a cute little euke.

It came with a complete kit for beginners or not! this is a great idea for those looking for quality and affordable pricing! My daughter brings hers to school everday, Music teacher said it was nice instrument. Tuned nicely and maintains tuned notes if played regularly. Was a good choice!
name: Angela Topel Aldaco

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
content: The quality of the instrument is top notch.  I mean, it's $40, so you can't expect the same intonation as from a professional instrument, but it works just fine for a beginner.  The materials are great, with real wood all around.  The only thing is that the rainbow strings that come with the instrument are utter shite.  No matter how much you get them stretched out, they keep stretching.  Not just between playing sessions, but *during* playing sessions.  I got a set of D'Addario Platinum soprano strings and am much happier.  They got bedded in and stretched out within one or two sessions and now the instrument sounds just fine.  I would have liked a low-G string, but I'll take care of that later.TL;DR: I can recommend this, but don't use the strings that come with it.  Get better ones.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
short_d: Great fun at a great price
content: There could be a list of weird things people buy when in isolation but Ive been wanting to learn the ukulele for some time. I am so glad I purchased the soprano with the tuner and bag. I used the tuner often and with out it I would be very frustrated trying to tune on my own as often as I do. The warm brown color was beautiful and the size perfect for my inexperienced hands. The strings are not painful like guitar strings are. I am average size for an adult and this  soprano size fit well for me. Would also work well for a child.  A larger person may prefer a bigger baritone or concert size tho. I am glad the bag is sturdy because I plan to take this baby with me everywhere now.  I didn't need any experience to play as there are many online lessons to choose from. I learned 4 basic cords and I was off and running.  I am having the best time with my new little friend.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
content: I received this a couple of months ago but haven’t had a chance to play it until now. I have been playing and tuning it daily for the past 2-3 weeks. My C string will NOT stay tuned no matter what I do. It IMMEDIATELY goes out of tune (within seconds of playing) and I have tried several different things to correct the issue but nothing helps. I believe it’s because the peg wobbles. I have tightened down all the screws and it still wiggles back and forth when all the other pegs are solid in place and good quality. This is beyond frustrating. I had hoped the metal pegs would make it a decent quality uke but it looks and feels cheap. On top of that has a twangy sound (which could just be how sopranos sound).Do not get a soprano if you are a larger person. When I saw the reviews that said it’s great for beginners I believed them but it’s difficult to hold correctly unless you are a smaller person or child. Thank goodness for the neck strap. SO Please do your research outside of amazon reviews to get the right size for you.I do love that it came with an extra string (yes ONE, and I’m not sure if it’s G or A but it’s a thinner string. I thought it would come with 4 extra strings so was disappointed that this wasn’t the case) picks, a neck strap and a tuner. This is all very helpful for a beginner. The bag is just a flimsy canvas material and will not protect your instrument very well.This is an ok starter if you are a beginner like me BUT you will need to upgrade to a better quality uke. So if you can afford it I would just start with a better quality one to begin with.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
short_d: Doesn't tune? DON'T WORRY keep at it
content: Ok, so I ordered this for my son for Christmas. I spent ALL DAY tuning this stupid thing. I packed it up to send it back. And the I Googled. Turns out plastic strings stretch, which makes perfect sense to be honest, and it takes a little time to work themselves in. Also, apparently ukes are pretty much never in tune and have to be regularly tuned from what I've read.Now I feel bad for blaming pretty common ukulele issues on this brand and their product.I decided to keep it, gave it to my son for Christmas. It was a hit, but honestly I think I enjoy it more. Yes I have to tune it every time I pull it out, but it's very close now and just a tweak or two here and there. The included tuner makes it super breezy.Read up, follow instructions, and understand some common ukulele quirks and enjoy your instrument.Is it the best? I have no idea, I can't even play the thing yet. It's fun though, and I'm trying to pick it up with my son.The rainbow strings are pretty, my son loves it, and it sounds since to our amateur ears.

short_d: Great beginning uke with all the accessories you will need
content: This is a good ukulele for first timers, and for children with their small hands. As with any new uke, it’s takes a few days of constantly tuning and stretching the strings to break them in and get them settled. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the quality of the strings is a little more “twangy” than my preference for a traditional ukulele sound...but the timbre of the strings did improve slightly as the strings were broken in. All the accessories that come with this set are great,too. The tuner is fantastic and has multiple settings for tuning many instruments and is very easy to use/read for those who may not have a lot of musical experience. Overall, definitely worth the price!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
content: My new years resolution this year was to learn an instrument. I figured it might be pretty easy to learn on a uke since it's small and only has a few strings. Since I wasn't sure if I'd be any good at figuring out chords, I chose this inexpensive ukulele, thinking it would be a good start. And it had lots of positive reviews. But, unfortunately, The minute I start strumming, the strings go off key so 4-5 notes in, I'm off key. It's making learning to play really frustrating.UPDATE: I talked to my friend about my issues and he told me that I should just keep tuning and strumming and tuning and strumming for a couple hours to work the strings out. Well, it took almost 3 hours of strumming but it's finally able to hold the note for long periods. I adjusted my stars.

short_d: First Ukulele I have ever bought.
content: Now before you start looking as to what is provided. This is the Black Soprano Ukulele. It has a very nice sound, first time using it it went out of tune because of new strings. Picks are made of plastic and the electronic tuner has a battery with it in between the clasp when you open it new. The strap is a little small for me because it is 22 inches long (55.88 centimeters) and the Ukulele is about 21 inches (53.34 centimeters) It seems like a good beginner product. It needs plenty of tuning. Once you get it tuned it sounds great. Everything was packaged pretty well and I had no complaints since I received it. All in all it is a great beginner Ukulele, the strap is a little small because I have a rather large chest.  It isn’t a deal breaker. If you look down below you can see what is all provided in the box. The price is a good for a starter.It comes with the followingSoprano Ukulele (of selected color)Strap (I think it’s different with color of Ukulele)2 picksLearners BookletCleaning ClothElectronic TunerAnd Cloth Case

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
content: This Ukulele is cheaply made, but you get what you pay for. I wasn't expecting fine quality, but at least something that would hold a tune for more than 30 seconds. The G string tuner nut is not installed properly and will not tighten down to hold the string in tune at all. I have not contacted the company yet about the defect, so I will update this review once I find out what kind of customer service they provide and how well they stand behind their product when it is defective.UPDATE #1 - I contacted the company and they are sending a replacement ukulele. They did not ask me to send the defective one back. They also said they upgraded the ukulele to a "better quality" one than I bought. I'm giving three stars for customer service, not for the ukulele. I will update again when the new one arrives.UPDATE #2 - We received the new upgraded ukulele, which is this one: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07SGHGZMG/ref=emc_b_5_t. It is definitely better quality and stays in tune. The gig bag on the new one has a pocket on the front which helps contain the picks, tuner, etc. - the original did not have an accessory pocket. The review on the original ukulele is going back to a one-star only because of the quality of the product (manufacturer); however, due to the excellent customer service I received (seller), I am going to leave a new review on the replacement ukulele link. If you are thinking of purchasing a ukulele, skip this one and get a better quality.
name: Lynette

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
content: This is not a professional instrument. It is designed to be a super cheap option to learn the basics on while you decide what you, personally, really want from your uke. For that, this is an ideal set at an incredible price. Aside from the gig bag, the accessories were awesome. The tuner is great. Kiddo loved the harmonica; I could have lived w/o since I don't play or care to play harmonica. Maybe the offspring will learn on it's own. The gig bag opens at the bottom instead of along the side making it a PITA to get the uke in or out. It is also made of cheap materials. It will do in a pinch. The uke itself is sturdy enough to survive a child - as long as they don't try to Pete Townshend it on a hard floor. It's easy enough for a kid to tune and play and bright enough to entice them to pick it up. I prefer the classic wood finish, myself, unless I am opting for a waterproof uke. Has a decent sound. No complaints.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2019
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. I was a little skeptical about some of the reviews about this uke. I've never played a string instrument before and I wanted something that I could learn on yet feel feminine. (I'm a girl at heart.) At the age of 36, I'm learning chords. I absolutely love picking this thing up and attempting to learn. I was slightly disappointed by the bag. Ive made sure to include a photo so you can clearly see it is NOT a hard case. The color is bright and I probably should have gone with a pale baby pink hue. (that's more my style.)  The only problem I had with tuning so far as been with the tuner that came with the kit. Since Im very NEW to learning. I had no idea how to actually tune a Uke. The tuner hasn't been able to get a proper tuning on the C string. I had to rely on other methods to tune it. Thankfully, I had the resources to use an App to tune my Uke. My fingers hurt and I'm playing a little each day. If children are getting this for the first time, be prepared to encourage finger soreness so they don't lose interest. As an adult, the pain I'm experiencing makes touching common house hold items sensitive to say the least. (typing is a little bothersome.) The song book has been handy too, i suggest buying additional supplemental material to enhance the experience of learning, especially if Internet resources are not an option. You wont have enough to keep someone engaged in learning with just this kit alone. In all I am so in love with this Uke. She's perfect for a beginner. I will be investing in a larger more expensive uke as my skill progresses.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
content: All in all, this was a great purchase. The warning to keep tuning and give the instrument and wood time to adjust to the surroundings was key. Its been a few days since I got my ukulele and I have to tune it VERY frequently. Most of the tutorial videos I've been watching are telling me that this eases up in time as the instrument gets used to the climate (currently in CA). The sound is great. I opted for the one with multicoloured strings to help me visually. I really enjoyed that the kit came with picks and a free harmonica. My main problems with the set and for not giving the product 5 stars are as follows; there are no instructions on how to use the neck strap and it is unclear. Google searches have also not been helpful with this. The ukulele itself does not have any spots to connect a regular strap. The tuner that comes with the set is also not very easy to use. There are minimal instructions on how to use it and I found that it did not pick up sound very well from the instrument. Ultimately I ended up downloading a tuning app on my phone for free. These, of course, are very minor, which is why I still rated the product highly. I hope to continue learning the instrument and pick up harmonica. All in all, I think this is a great kit for beginners for the price.

short_d: Please oh please do not buy this

No combination of fingering on the frets could play any sort of chord, it sounded worse than Mariah Carey's 2014 Rockefeller Center performance of All I Want For Christmas is You.Please don't waste your money on this if you're actually serious about learning/playing.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2019
short_d: I ordered used one and everything's good enough
content: I ordered used one and it came with everything listed in the description except for a harmonica.The repackaging was good and it was shipped as a priority mail.The ukulele looks/feels like new. The color (mahogany) is bright & beautiful and texture of the body feels good. I found a few dents on the head and neck but it's okay with me.It is easy to tune thanks to the digital tuner that came with the uku but it seems like the tuners on the uku don't hold the strings tightly, I need to tune again after playing a bit. Or it could be a beginner's mistake.Only one thing disappointed me is the zipper pull of gig bag is missing. But overally this kit is really good for beginners who want to try and get used to uku for the first time!Updated: It's been 2 weeks I have been playing this uke, and I love it so much. It sounds clear, loud enough, and beautiful. The tuning issue I had is not happening anymore. Of course, I need to check and tight the strings just a little bit before playing it but they are not way off, they stay in tune. If you're a pro uke player or looking for high quality ukes, I can't say this one is the best for you. BUT, for beginners, it can be your go-to uke for sure.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
short_d: This is great to start your Ukulele journey.  Sounds good, and a great price!
content: I purchased the black one, which matches the color of my guitars. I have not spent any time with the ukulele before, but really wanted to learn. This is the perfect entry into the world. The fact that it not only comes with a tuner, but it is a chromatic tuner, so it works well for tuning the dulcimer I own as well (It can also do tuning for both standard ukulele turnings C and D).  The sound it produces sounds like a ukulele! Exactly what you would want!  I can not recommend this highly enough for anyone who wants to start playing.A few things to note ESPECIALLY if you have never played before.1. Your strings WILL NEED TO STRETCH (It will seem like the thing is falling out of tune in mere minutes, it technically is but it's not that anything is bad - there are tutorials on how to stretch)2. You MUST TUNE IT WHEN YOU GET IT!  This is common knowledge, but if this is your first instrument you might think you can just play it out of the box.  The cool thing is that it comes WITH the tuner, it really is everything you need to start playing.3. If you played guitar before, you might freak out that they "Strung it wrong" They did not, thicker strings are in the middle, with thinner outsides (Re-entrant style)With this order I got a bonus, which was a 10-hole harmonica - It actually sounds really great, not like a kids harmonica , but an actual musical instrument.

content: Just bought this for my 4 year old daughter for Valentine’s Day but decided to keep it for myself and gave her flowers. After jamming out every time my kids have been sleeping for the past few days, the strings are broken in and magic is spilling from my fingers regularly. Actually, when I first opened the box there was an aura that seemed to hit me instantly, and I knew right away that my uke and I are going places. I’ve never played an instrument before, but planning to get pretty famous fairly quickly, so watch for tour dates. Also getting one for my daughter because once I’m an expert in a few weeks I can teach her, and we can go on the road together to make some extra cash.Also comes with a free harmonica which I gave to my 2 year old son. date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2019
short_d: Solid ukulele but the strings are really hard.
content: My husband and I got ukuleles as something small to keep us entertained when we start living on the road full time.This one is mine and he got a different brand so I have some good comparisons. The mahogany ukulele is solid and produces a great sound. Our other ukulele has a tin can sound to it but this one is more rugged and solid so it doesn't give off an echoing noise.The carrying case is much better than the one that came with my husband's and the tuner and strap were great additions. Before we had a tuner, we were using an app on our phone but since we got the tuner we stopped using the app completely because it's so easy to use.My only complaint is the strings. The strings on my husband's ukulele are easier to hold down than the strings on this one. I have to press so hard to hold down these strings, it actually makes the tips of my fingers go numb. I dont have this issue with our other ukulele.Overall it's a nice ukulele though!

name: Amazon Customer

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2019
short_d: Great starter Uke for someone interested in starting the journey, with some caveats.
content: I'm giving this item 4 stars, because even though it requires a small effort to make it a good instrument, it's perfectly in line with its price range and arrived as described. A lot of other reviews complain about this Uke not being able to hold a tune. I found I had the same issues, but quickly identified the culprit.  The tuning pegs not securely screwed in to the head and the provided strings are what you would find on a toy. But Strings are a consumable on a Uke, the strings that ship with an inexpensive instrument always lower quality and you should consider replacing them on most sub 80 dollar Ukes if you want it to sound good and tune well.The tuning pegs are an easy fix, just tighten the screws on the back of the head. Takes less than a minute. The strings however are going to cost about 5 dollars for decent strings and about 30 minutes to swap them out the first item you do it.With both of those fixes in place the ukulele is well worth the price if you have a young child looking to learn the instrument. I'd recommend just tossing some 5 dollar Aguila strings in your cart alongside it, and make sure you account for those when price comparing.

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019
content: I was so excited to gift this to our 7yr old for Christmas. Music is a big part of our lives & she just started showing serious interest- talking about playing a guitar & singing. So I figured I would get her this. To start.Yes- I’m very aware this is not some super high quality, top of the line instrument. But I didn’t want to spend hundreds of dollars either on something that would turn into all of 2 weeks of interest. So I thought this was a great jumping off point.Good news- not just a phase. Having this has definitely ignited something further in her. To the point where she locks herself away with it, a pencil & paper and writes songs. It’s beautiful to watch.Bad news- it’s also an endless source of frustration for us both because it NEVER F¥€£IN HOLDS ITS TUNE!!!  It comes with a digital tuner too which I thought was great. And it is. The tuner is wonderful & it’ll be easily transferable to our next string instrument I believe. But one of the strings particularly is SO hard to tune correctly & then by the time you think they’re all good to go, do one final check again & discover at least one note is off. Again. It’s never ending.So now that my passionate girl is trying to really dig into this, she can’t because it always sounds wonky. It always sounds flat. Something is always off.So if you wanna make a very small child feel special with a fancy toy- this is perfect. If anyone of any age is genuinely wanting to play an accurate tune- forget it. Just spend the extra money on another. Check out your local pawn shop or used instrument store. Get a REAL instrument. Not this toy.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
content: My wife has wanted a ukulele for a long time, but she's never played before. I thought it would be nice to get her a beginner ukulele and surprise her with it, and with learning a song to serenade her with. I got this kit because the price was right and I thought it would be a great way for us *both* to learn. The ukulele feels solid enough, and the accessories this kit comes with are great. However, the ukulele will not stay in tune. At all. I have tuned it using the included tuner. I went out and bought another, more expensive tuner thinking maybe the issue is the tuner itself. Nope. Perfectly in tune (by both tuners standards) and after playing it for 5 minutes, the uke is way, way, WAY out of tune. I brought it to a local music shop to pay to have it tuned, thinking maybe it was just me. After leaving the uke there all day, when I went to pick it up, the guy at the music store told me he wasn't charging me because he couldn't get it to stay in tune either. He offered to adjust the tuning mechanism, but honestly, that would have cost me more than just buying a brand new ukulele.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019
content: For a beginner uke, this is a solid 3.5. This was my first uke and I had a strong motivation to learn how to play. However if you’re looking for a uke to play just because, or if you don’t have much excitement beforehand, this would be a hard ukulele to start with. The action on it is a little too high for a beginner. Its harder to press down on the strings which can easily drive away someone who’s not very serious about learning. The last picture is this ukulele beside my concert sized. I paid about 60$ more for it and the difference makes this one look like a kid’s toy. I played this soprano for several weeks and I thought ukuleles were just supposed to sound this way, but when I realized I was serious about playing I was willing to invest a little more into the hobby.In conclusion:For beginners with high motivation on a budget, this uke is for you.For beginners with a wider price range, I suggest looking into brands like flight and Luna. You can get a nice sounding uke for only 100$I recommend this ukulele if you’re looking to start but don’t want to spend too much. However if you’ve played high quality ukes before, you’ll immediately notice the difference.Disclaimer?? : the concert ukulele in the last pic is a Elise ecklund’s signature uke with flight

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
content: bought this for my daughter who was very excited to receive it.  I even bought the protection plan just in case.  Out of the box it looks good but that is it.  I tried to tune this for weeks.  It wouldn't hold a tune for more than a minute at best.  I even tightened the screws on the tuning nuts hoping they would stay in place.  My daughter went from loving music class and wanting her own instrument to practice to a frustrated, disinterested student which is what bothered me the most.  I'm sending this back and hoping for a refund and going to a local music store so I can actually see and hear what I'm getting.As for the Asurian protection plan;  don't waste your time or money on that either.  They wasted my time and just referred me back to amazon.  For added insult, you can't return them or get a refund on that service so just stay away from them in all forms.  Absolutely useless.

content: Purchased this ukulele kit for my daughter's birthday (a ukulele was at the top of the list).  It arrived on time and exactly as described. However, with a little youtube instruction the kid is able to play a few tunes, tune the instrument with the provided tuner, and play these tunes without burning my ears. She absolutely loves it an carries the thing with her everywhere.  The sound of the instrument is as expected, and know that it isn't that of a high quality instrument- but she is a beginner.  If she decided in a couple weeks she was no longer interested, I would already feel it was money well spent and would re-gift/share with someone else.  It's absolutely perfect.

short_d: It's a good set for the price
content: It's a good set for the price, but it is not for anyone serious about learning to play the ukulele.  This was a gift for my young son (5 years old), and he loves it.  It is totally appropriate for a young child.  The case is cheap quality and doesn't have a pocket to store the extra strings or tuner.  The book doesn't actually tell one how to play the instrument, just gives some tabs for a few songs.  The strings are the worst, though.  They are made out of a cheap plastic that stretches.  So when you try to tune the ukulele, you can never get it tight enough to reach the desired pitch before it stretches out again.

name: Jenna

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2018
short_d: Great Starter Kit for Very Low Price
content: Bought for one of my children. Saw it got many good reviews (4-5 stars) & a few dud ones (1 star). At such a low price (-$30) decided to give it a shot, after all even dud review mentioned he was able to return it. For the price this uke surely deserves 5 stars. Everything works and works well. This is a serious very inexpensive option for a starter set.Don't get me wrong, when my child learns three songs I promised her a Kala, but this Uke will not go to waste as two of her younger siblings are already begging to take over this one. Update: She learned 3 songs easily from tutorial book included, simplistic but she learned them hardly asking daddy for help, so props to let book too.As to the many who complain about its staying in tune, I have noticed it is sensitive to humidity & temperature. Do not see it as big problem. After a couple days it evened out & all ukuleles have this problem. Tuner included makes it easy to tune it in under a minute.As to set-up: Nut was at good height. When I filed saddle down to allow about 3mm at 12th fret intonation was perfect, not just acceptable, PERFECT, pretty amazing on uke at this price.Adding a thought here on this cute little uke: Just finished evaluating all uses in pic & my kids (5-10) & I found the rainbow strings the most pleasant to play. Dad does not notice it much, but nice touch on this trainer uke.
name: Ian Mclean

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2018
content: I'm just a beginner on the ukulele but this instrument seems okay to me.  I like the clip-on tuner that comes in the pack.  Make sure the tuner is in the right mode, though (either C for chromatic of Uc for soprano uke),  Expect to retune constantly while the nylon strings are stretching out.  That may take weeks, if my experience is any guide.  A uke from a music store may have the strings already stretched out and stable but you may pay more.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2018
content: This is a beginner package for a 5yr old and we got one for our 10yr old as well.  It's a fake wood ukulele which somewhat stays in tune.  The strings are nylon and easy on the hands, and the tuners for the most part keep it in tune.  If you're looking for a high quality ukulele, again this is a beginner package to get you going.  I'm giving it 3 stars because this package was exactly what was described, and it provides hours of music time for the kids as they explore what interests them, while not making me bankrupt.  I took 2 stars away because the one thing which I did not like is how they said it was, "SUPERIOR-QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP" because it's not, also the bag included is not even padded, it's thin nylon.  Of course this is an entry level beginner package, so don't expect any of the included accessories to be high quality.  They are not, nor are they good quality, they are maybe what would be considered adequate. I'm not saying pass on this because it is a, "value pack" it does include everything needed to get started.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2018
content: Very nice bundle that includes everything a beginner would need to get started. I received everything exactly as pictured. I don't know much about ukuleles, but this one looks, works, and sounds pretty good as far as I know. I wasn't sure about getting one with a strap and buttons at first since I had not seen many options set up with one. For me the strap has become the most used accessory with this bundle, it has become extremely handy in keeping the ukulele with me for the many hours of practice it is taking for me to learn.The tuner is compact and easy to use. The instruction book that’s included shows you how to use the tuner to get the ukulele just right. I rarely use the picks but have attached the pick holder to the ukulele near the neck so they are out of the way but handy if needed.The bag is very simple but serves the purpose with a handle and a shoulder strap. I may want to upgrade to a more padded bag someday with more storage space in the external pockets.

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2018
short_d: Perfect Product for a Perfect Price
content: I used my $50 Amazon gift card to buy this, hoping and praying it'd be good and not a waste of my money. Prayers answered! While the box was slightly opened when it came, I used the included tuner and a YouTube video (as a guide for how high the strings should be) to tune it to perfection. It does go out of tune extremely quickly at first, but the more you retune it and play it the longer it lasts. This is normal because the ukulele needs to 'get used to' and 'stretch out its strings' to accommodate being tuned properly. It'll be this way for a week or so. The sound it beautiful. My initial thought as I was taking it out of the box was, absolutely gorgeous! I purchased honey. Beautiful instrument with everything you need!! But the strap is useless... Perfect product and definitely a perfect price!!!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
content: I used to play guitar when I was younger, so when my daughter asked for a ukulele, I jumped on this ukulele during a Lightning Deal.It is easier to tune than my guitar used to be. The tuner works really well and is easy for kids new to tuning to understand.The booklet is a good starting book. It uses a finger notation, which can be easier for learners to pick up on their own. It also has a listing of chords in the back, for learners that would rather explore without playing the sample songs. It is small, so those that are more familiar with other instruments may want to pick up something additional to also use.The pink version is pictured well. It is a bright pink, as is the carrying bag.I haven’t had to restring it yet, but I’m glad to have a spare on hand for the inevitable.As others have noted, the packing in the box was excellent.

short_d: Quality product, as-advertised; Can't beat the price
content: I decided I wanted to learn ukulele, not having been any kind of strings player before.  This soprano ukulele seems to be constructed very well, and the photos on this product page match exactly what I received.  For the price, getting a ukulele, plus digital tuner, pick, extra 'A' string, a carrying sleeve (to be clear, the case is more of a very thin sleeve), a hook strap, cleaning cloth and basic songbook pamphlet, I don't know how I could do any better.  With the pamphlet as a starting point, there's lots of other online resources and smartphone apps to extend my learning.  I haven't had my soprano ukulele long, but I'm looking forward to playing and practicing a bit each day.

content: I was so excited when I received this ukulele as a Christmas present, only to have it break a few hours later. I was overjoyed to get the gift, after weeks of antipation and excitement. The thing is, I know ukuleles take a while to get them to stay in tune, but it went out of tune abnormally fast. I’d finish tuning one string, and when I came back a few minutes later, it had already gone out by 4+ notes. So I never actually got to play it. Later in the day, I was tuning it, and the G string popped, I may have gotten it too tight, but nothing seemed to be going right with this ukulele. Also, I was extremely disappointed to find that the carrying case was horrible. It was paper thin, with no pockets and inconvient to get the ukulele in and out.I plan on getting the strings changed on the ukulele, but if that doesn’t help I’ll be returning it. Really disappointed.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2017
short_d: Just a Toy; Horrible Intonation; Much Better Choices for Just $20 more.
content: I've had this for about a week and I can say that this ukulele really is a toy for kids to beat up and pretend to play.  While it purports to be a beginner's instrument, the bridge is way too high, causing the strings to be ridiculously high over the soundhole.  This instrument does not have a good sound.  The intonation is unforgivingly horrible.  You can tune GCEA but fret any note and it'll almost certainly be 25% sharp.  The strings have settled down and can stay in tune when not fretted, but simple G chords still sound plinky and out of tune.  I realize that it's a cheap instrument but it's not useable.  I've had great luck with a Donner Concert Uke which I purchased for about $20 more.  The tone on the Donner is far better than it is on this.  I'll be returning this.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2017
short_d: Doesn't hold pitch after a week of daily tuning. Hard for a child to play.
content: I bought this as a first instrument for my 4-year-old. I wasn't too worried about the quality, just that it would be functional enough for him to learn some basics and stay excited about music. Unfortunately, after keeping it inside in a stable environment for two weeks and tuning it EVERY DAY for the past week, it still doesn't hold pitch. Two of the strings de-tune seconds after being tuned. The other two will drop a half step to a whole step overnight. I play several other stringed instruments and also got a slightly more expensive ukelele for myself on Amazon so I could play with my kid. The better ukelele (a Kala KA-15S Mahogany Soprano Ukulele) needed to be tuned a lot on the first day, adjusted a bit on the second day, and has kept its pitch well since then.There's one other problem with this ukelele: the bridge and bar at the top of the neck are both extremely high, which means that you have to exert a LOT of pressure to keep the strings down. It's nothing compared to a steel-string guitar or anything, but my 4-year-old refused to play the instrument because it hurt his fingers. He preferred the Kala which was designed better and doesn't bite into his fingers. It probably wouldn't be a big deal for an adult, but for a young child it was another thing that made this a poor first instrument.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2017
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. This honey color 21 inch Ukulele is a nice kit for beginner. For beginner, most of music teachers will suggest choose between Soprano (21 inch) or Concert (23 inch) Otherwise, the range can be small like pocket (16 inch) or big as contrabass (32 inch).This Ukulele was made from rosewood and basswood. All strings are made from Nylon. The weight is around 1 pound. Besides Ukulele, the kit also came with one storage bag, microfiber cloth, spare pick, string and etc. The digital tuner is very useful for me. I use it every time when I do the tuning. It is hard for me to get the correct tone. I need to spent at least half hour for tuning at the first week. It will be nightmare without the digital tuner. Now I use C6 TUNINGF: G4-C4-E4-A4. I am tuning my G string little higher for close harmony sound. The company offers 6 colors, I am glad that I pick the Honey one. The color fits me well. I owned this for over months, so far so good. I wish they also offer strap in this kit. It will help a lot when I play Ukulele. Without strap, it is easy to fall when I stand up to play. By the way tuning is needed for every musical instrument with strings. I did compare another one, it seems taking longer time for tuning. For people who hate tuning or pick up about sound, please beware that before you make any decisions. Again we paid for what we get. All the words above might only apply to beginner of Ukulele, music is different for everyone. Every one will have own judge.

name: love a good sandal

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
short_d: This is a toy, not a real instrument
content: I really wish I could have loved this. After playing for four days, I STILL could not get the strings to stay tuned for more than about a minute. I'd stretched them out and retuned over and over each day. Without even playing the A string, that one would have to be retuned repeatedly. Took it to a local music store for lessons and the teacher told me this thing is more of a toy than a real instrument. Returned it for a refund and bought one locally. Strings hold the tune for MUCH longer and have to be tweaked only a couple of times per hour in the first couple of days. Much better sound, higher quality if you spend just $20 more.
name: Allison

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
content: My 8 year old daughter loves this. Nice quality sound and feel. The electronic tuner is a bit tricky to get the hang of, and you will need to tune it every day for the first week while strings stretch out. But once you get a feel for the sensitivity of the tuner, it works well. NOTE: Strings are labeled 1 through 4 from the bottom up, not top down, when holding the ukulele right handed. (This was not obvious to me, but I have never played any kind of guitar before.)

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2017
short_d: He is very happy with this
content: Yes, everjoys-Soprano ukulele is the right Soprano Ukulele I have been looking for. It arrived earlier and very well packed, just the way I expected.My wife and I are guitar players，we have been looking for a right Soprano Ukulele for my son who has a deep interest in music, especially the string instrument. So, I bought this. He is very happy with this. Now, he has started the journey of learning ukulele.The wood used for the whole body is high quality and it is not a toy ukulele, it is an instrument which is suitable for the starter. The blackwood fingerboard and bridge looks so cool and like my professional guitar. The workmanship is fine. It is smooth to touch and the finishing is very neat. The strings are high quality which can be played well after you tune the ukulele with everjoys-Soprano digital tuner. The color string is much easier for a starter to learn and remember the different note.The songbook is quite useful for a starter to know and to use the ukulele. There are also quite many songs to learn in it. As a professional guitar player, I am satisfied with this everjoys-Soprano Soprano Ukulele.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
short_d: For a beginner ukulele player, this is a great starting kit!
content: The whole kit is great for a beginner. Maybe even for a non-beginner. Comes with everything you need to get stated and finding songs on YouTube to learn makes learning easy and fun. This is a stretch but the only complaint I've had was with the ends of the cut strings on the bridge.  They tend to poke my strumming hand the way the strings are installed but I helped it a little by taking a fingernail file and rounding the ends over.  When I replace the strings, I think I can prevent this issue but for now, the filing helped enough.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to learn to play the ukulele.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
content: This is my first ukulele purchase, so I don’t have too much to compare this ukulele to. I ended up selecting this particular ukulele because of the reviews and the affordable price. It does play easily out of the box, was easy to tune, and the bag is very nice. The sound is surprisingly louder than anticipated, and the tone is beautiful. There are minor imperfections on my fretboard and I’m really not a fan of the engraved design around the sound hole and on the headstock. I can’t tell what it’s supposed to be, to be honest! It seems to be a decent instrument for the price and a good one to begin with. I’ve been playing almost daily for 3-4 weeks and the stings have just started to hold the notes, so give that some time. I would suggest this for a beginner who is looking for something affordable to get started. And, the bag is a bonus because many reviews of other bundles said the bags were flimsy. Not the case here!

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
content: I've had my Ukulele for just short of four months now and I'm really impressed. I have some friends who are also learning now and while this is still a laminate ukulele it has a much sturdier and less "plasticy" feel to it. Obviously at four months, I can't say how long this will last but comparatively, I feel like this ukulele will be around a lot longer. It has stayed in tune really well and I love the classic look of this ukulele and the design on the rosette. It has a nice tone to it and has stayed in tune really well. It also projects really well and can play quite loud. I have the tenor and recognize that influences volume compared to my friends soprano's and concert's but I think overall this ukulele just projects better than theirs. The case it came with is pretty thick and seems well made and durable. I also like the tuner that came with the ukulele. My sister got a different ukulele around the same time and her tuner is kind of a pain. This one clips on so easily and is really easy to use. I also appreciated that the strap buttons were already installed. I wasn't sure at first if I'd want to play with a strap or not but I found it much more comfortable with and the idea of installing those myself was quite daunting. This is my first venture into string instruments and I've really enjoyed it!

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020
content: Just got it in yesterday but already learned how to play Israel Kamakawiwo'ole's Over the Rainbow, as an absolute beginner on the ukelele (I am a guitar player though). This is an incredible value. The wood is beautiful, and fits in nicely alongside my guitar. Of course it's the right size for children to play too, but as an adult I appreciate how nice it looks in the house. It's clear that it's mass produced, with laser etchings and there were some remnants of the production process left behind that brushed off, but for the price that's expected. What I didn't expect was that it would play so well. It sounds great, the stock strings it shipped with tuned up well, and I didn't have any of the issues other reviewers had with frets being too high or anything like that. For those complaining about the tuner pegs, first note that new strings (especially nylon) stretch out significantly and you will have to keep retuning it until it settles in. And, if you really did get faulty tuning pegs, there is a warranty, or replacement pegs are cheap and easy to install. I also did not have issues with the included tuner, except that it buzzes/rattles when I play, so I can't keep it attached when I play unfortunately. All in all, I'm super happy with this purchase, and can't wait to use it while camping.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
short_d: Solid value for a beginers instrument package.
content: Generally seems well built and better made than expected. Nice looking, traditional Uke. Comes strung, but of course very out of tune, it took some time to get the stretch out of the strings. The tuner is a little confusing to use at first but unless you have a piano or other standard to use (or perfect pitch) it's a nice item to have. Had to tune and re-tune the instrument several times over a couple of hours before it settled-in and for the most part stayed close to being in tune. Go slow and be patient.  (I suspect it should get even better after a few days) The extra set of stings are always good to have on hand for any stringed instrument. I was happy this came with a set as I was a little concerned about breaking one while tuning, but having the extra set made it not so much of a big deal. The gig bag is much better than you might expect with a beginners package, more than adequate and is well padded. It is not on par with a Martin or other high end instrument but certainly a good playing and nice sounding Ukulele for a beginner or even intermediate player.  Not the cheapest or most expensive but certainly a Good Value.

short_d: Cliche "you get what you pay for"
content: I really hoped this would be it. I bought a joke ukelele for my 16 yr old or christmas until his guitar would come and I found I really love to play it. It's therapeutic and makes me happy. It was $20 and cheap feeling so I thought, since I was picking it up easy, thatd I'd get a better one.I bought this. This ukulele will NOT stay tuned even a little bit. Every time I play, I have to tune it. If it sits there for a few days, I have to tune it. I'm not talking small adjustments either. Not even in the range of the correct note. I didnt buy high end being a beginner, but I thought it'd work better than the $20 uke I bought as a joke! It's the same issue and reason I bought a "better one".  The price was worth the kit you got. You get what you pay for as you always hear.. which.. is kind of sad if you think about the kids who have major musical talents but cant afford a decent instrument.. and, as well, The tuner doesnt work. I have to use my piano.

short_d: I love it! It's amazing! However, good times don't last long...
content: I love this Ukulele. I've had this for a little less then a year. It's been my bread and butter, and my partner in crime. Rarely does a day go by that I don't touch this ukulele. However...One day, after picking it up and getting ready to play my rendition of "Fly me to the moon", I go for C major, ANNNDD!... dead. The neck had warped. My A string's top 3 frets are dead... I look down the neck and sure enough, it's got a slight warp to it. I was devastated. I spent days looking up ways to fix it, and unfortunately, this type of Ukulele doesn't have a way to fix the neck.TL;DR: Good Ukulele. Damn good. However after constant use, the neck warped on me, and I am left devastated with no way to fix it. I'll have to buy a new one, after having my trusty partner for less than a year.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
content: First of all, the bundle is totally worth it, and I'd buy this setup again.  I love having the carrying case so I can bring it wherever I want and not worry about damaging it.  Also, the tuner is essential!  I didn't know anything about ukulele before I bought this, so I quickly learned how necessary the tuner is to making the music sound good.  I also really liked playing with the strap when I first started as I wasn't totally sure how to hold it, move my fingers, and strum without losing my grip.  More exciting than anything is how quickly you'll be able to learn how to play.  I mostly went on YouTube and studied tutorials for a while and made sure to practice for about an hour every day.  One month later and my calloused fingers are already healed, I've got about 10-15 songs under my belt, and I've really gotten the hang of playing/singing at the same time!

content: While we have only had this for a day now, we are very happy with it. The sound is great, looks well made and not cheap like some I've seen. We, admittedly,  are not Ukulele experts, though. My husband plays guitar, so I feel we at least aren't totally new to stringed instruments... So, this Ukulele has the sound, the quality, and so much included with it, this is basically a no-brainer. You don't need a brain to buy this, truly. Just do it. Ok, seriously, I also felt like many of the other reviews for this were of people who had much more knowledge and many more Ukuleles than my 0 that I already had. So, I did go off of the large amount of 5 stars and very well written and thought out reviews. Other cheaper or similarly priced Ukukeles seemed to get a lot of decent reviews from people like me- total newbs. We also bought this because my dad, who has made instruments (dulcimers, and hammer dulcimers) and has played the guitar in the past (and does not skimp on good quality) bought the same for my mom and was impressed by it as well.  My son and I are currently going through the lessons included as well as trying to learn "somewhere over the rainbow" because. Ukulele. I mean, really, who hasn't wanted to play a Ukulele after hearing that song?? Buy one.

name: Eradis

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
short_d: Razor sharp fret ends, form letter customer service.
content: I'm updating this review, now that I have gotten a reply from Ranch customer service.Short version: Most of the fret ends were unbelievably ragged, worse than anything I've seen. Customer service tried to be helpful, but failed to really grasp the problem. Response seemed a canned reply to a different fret problem. Intonation of G string sharp above 7th fret, rest of strings show good intonation to at least the 12th.Long version.First, I am not a musician, but I tinker with instruments for my own personal stress reduction, improving my hand motor skills, etc. I have been tinkering mostly with guitars, occasionally with others for about 30 years now.I play entirely on beginner instruments, and am in general aware of what to expect from them. Sure they're often laminate, with substandard tone, that's fine by me. I've had several with slightly sharp fret edges that I've filed and worked. I've never seen anything like the poor craftsmanship of the fret ends on this ukulele.Back in the day, you usually had fretboards that weren't flat, but that's not so common these days as machine-made instruments have gotten much better. Usually you find the frets need to be rounded at the corners a bit. Sometimes you have some fret sprout that needs to be filed down. Whatever, it happens. This is usually on a *small* number of frets.This Ukulele has 18 frets, for a total of 36 fret ends. 31 of the ends on this instrument are sharp and require work. Most have wide, ragged, flat burs hanging off the edges, like the were cut with an exceptionally dull cutter and left untreated after cutting. See the pictures I've attached. Those jagged, flaky looking bits at the edge are thin, razor sharp flakes of metal still attached to the fret. A few of the frets are noticeably short of the edge of the fretboard.Quite frankly, I received a completely unplayable ukulele due to unbelievably sharp frets. Sure, I could have gotten it into serviceable condition in an hour or two with a file. But for a new instrument claiming that:"Light and well built instrument, with the fret boards surprisingly smooth on every sides details, Neck is well connected and easy to navigate, the frets are nice and polished."The worst fret ends I've ever seen is *not* what I was expecting.When I emailed customer service, sending them the same fret-end closeup they replied with this explanation:"When we ship the ukuleles to Amazon, our QC will check every details of the uke to make sure there are no flaws on it. Of course the fret edges are very smooth at that time. But due to the natural properties of wood's thermal expansion and contraction, the uke's frets may have some bow."So, you're going to blame the jagged, rough unfinished edges on your fret on thermal expansion of the fretboard?Um, no. The metal ends did not magically become ragged as a result of the wood under them expanding. Most likely they were precut too short before being put on the fretboard, so the ends never got polished down after installation, and QC never noticed.  Later the fretboard shrank due to moisture changes the sharp edges started hanging over. Note the shrinkage didn't cause the problem, but rather the expansion masked a manufacturing defect. This is of course giving a possible explanation on why the edges weren't sharp when it went through their QC.Either way, the QC should have visually inspected the fret ends, at which point the jagged edges would have been seen, even if they couldn't be felt.It also sounds like the end of their email response is about the frets being bowed up out of the fretboard, not sharp at the ends. I think they cut-and-pasted some generic facts about fretboards, and picked the wrong one, this might explain the absurdly incompetent sounding reply.To their credit, they did offer me a partial refund if I wanted to fix it myself, and pointed me to the option of returning it to Amazon if not. If it were a minor problem, I'd take them up on it. but fixing nearly every fret on the instrument is way too much work. Back it goes to be replaced by a different brand.I also noticed the intonation of the G string is noticeably sharp above the 7th fret, but the others are on-pitch at the 12th and beyond. That's not really a deal killer, but a lot of the reviews talked about how great the intonation is. It i fine for a beginner instrument, but less great than the reviews claim.Other than that, the instrument seems reasonably well made. The tuning keys move smoothly, and look good although one has a few minor pits if you look really closely. The finish is thin, but even. The strap button at the bottom is a bit loose and wobbly. The included digital tuner is pretty basic, but functional enough. One drawback is it only shows the open string notes of either a Ukulele or Guitar (selectable). If you are more than a half-step off, the tuner won't tell you if you are sharp or flat. (ie: if your G is really an F#, you get no feedback). This might be an issue if you are restringing the instrument and your sense of pitch isn't very good, but you could use a smartphone app to get close and this for finer tuning.With all the reviews talking about how nice and smooth the frets are, I'm wondering if:1) I got a lemon2) Ranch switched OEM manufacturers and the quality went down3) the people buying these have rawhide for hands4) or these reviews are entirely fake.I'm guessing 1 or 2. A few hundred fake reviews is common on Amazon, but thousands? not as likely.While 1 star may sound harsh to some, I stand by it. They market this product as having well polished frets, these were atrocious. I might have been more lenient if it wasn't an marketed feature. The customer service email I got was also lacking, and really didn't help, even though they seemed to be trying.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
short_d: Don't give up if you get a less than perfect one
content: Ordered a tenor uku after x-mas, and it was shipped from Amazon's Hebron, Ky wearhouse. It showed up quickly and looked beautiful. After closer inspection I noticed that there was a small crack on the side of the fret board next to the 1st fret, then the wosrt thing I noticed was all the frets on the ends were rough and sharp. I felt like I would cut my fingers. I contacted Amazon and Ranch Guitars and I decided to send it back and get another one. The second one came from Amazon's Aurora, Co. wearhouse. It came quicker than the first one. This one was flawless no cracks and no rough frets, just smooth. The intonation was spot on. This is what they advertised, I'm glad I didn't give up.
name: Don Justus

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
content: I have been playing stringed instruments (guitar, ukulele, banjo etc) for over 50 years.  While the overall build quality of this instrument is very good, the nut is too high as is the bridge saddle.  For an experienced player this can be a minor annoyance that can be remedied by removing the saddle and sanding it down to get a lower action.  The nut slots can be cut deeper.  A beginner on the other hand, could become discouraged very easily.  The other issue with this ukulele is with the sharp edges of some of the frets.  On the plus side, even though this is not considered to be a high end instrument, it looks and sounds as good or better than those in the $100 and up range that I tried at the local "guitar barn".  The tuning machines work smoothly and the electronic tuner is accurate. The instrument was returned a few days after receiving it because of the sharp frets and high action problem.
name: B.B.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
short_d: Great product a couple tuning points though...
content: I thoroughly enjoy the ukelele but a couple reasons for me not putting a 5 star.....When I received the instrument of course I had to tune it as they keep strings very loose for shipping purposes. What I did not like is that I had to keep tuning the ukelele mid-play as it would not hold its tuning. Even after some extreme tightening, it still does not hold its tune especially after I set it aside for even 10 minutes.Craftsmanship is great, except for the price of this instrument it seems there are places that have been glued together where it would be much stronger if it were solid. Also I feel the timing issue may be the use of cheaper materials in the headstock/tuning pegs.Do not let these cons stop you from buying this instrument they are minor and if you dont know how to fix them a couple videos online could teach a monkey how to fix them in minutes.My recommendation after first unboxing is that you get a Phillipshead screwdriver and tighten your tuning pegs all around until it is not easy to turn and you have to use some slight force to turn the pegs...BEGINERS DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN AND STRIP YOUR PEGS. If you do this you will need new pegs and I'm not entirely sure that would be honest if you asked for a refund/exchange if you yourself did the damage. I have not read a review where someone recieved a defective product so they have a pretty good name....I hope you enjoy your playing and pay your respects to the late, great Bruddah Iz!

I got this during Prime days when it was half price and the difference between a $45 uke and a $100?  Whew - don't tell my niece.  This is so beautiful and came with really good accessories.  A lot of bundles will have a so-so, barely there case and a lame tuner.  Not only is this a finely crafted instrument but the case is a well constructed and padded case, the digital tuner is good quality as well.  I am very happy with this purchase, a little less so with my progress learning to play - but it's not because I don't have a beautifully toned instrument to learn on, I absolutely do.
name: Bajan Lady

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
content: I bought the 23" Ukulele just over month ago, and I thought I would soon stop playing it, just like any other instrument I tried to pick up.But soon I realized that it was the perfect instrument for me, it was so easy to use, learn, and the sound it made was beautiful. Words can't express how much I love this Ukulele, and I recommend it for beginners like me.The design is beautiful and the volume from this little instrument is amazing.The tuner has been working fine for the entire month I've had it. The strap was a little difficult to install without any real instruction (as I said, I'm a beginner), but I soon figured. It out I haven't had to replace any strings yet, and the case is water resistant!

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
content: The case is okay, the tuner is ok, the accessories are fine. The instrument itself is terrible (toy) quality. The tuners are super cheap, pitted, and not functional. I'm not sure if the frets are in the wrong spots or what but you can't get the notes you're supposed to get. Of three players, two who are adults, nobody can even use this for practice or backup. I'm baffled that this piece of garbage got good reviews. The Luna uke we have is night and day difference for honestly not that much more money and it is able to be tuned and stay tuned, and the notes you get are what you're supposed to get. I'll be returning this and looking for a functional back up instrument that isn't a toy. I can't believe anyone could learn to play an instrument using this toy, or perhaps given the bafflingly glowing reviews, the quality control is such that some are absolute garbage and some people get a great instrument. I dunno but the positive reviews sure didn't help my decision making and this page could really use some honesty to help other people seeking a functional instrument.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
short_d: Buy it, you won't be sorry!
content: I bought two of these.  One for my son and one for me.  My son's arrived in perfect order and it is such a joy to play.  He was delighted.  Mine arrived broken which I'm having replaced through Amazon so I'm only out a few weekend days of enjoyment and some inconvenience having to send the broken one back.The instrument looks great.  It feels good in the hands and it plays wonderfully.  I'm impressed by the intonation and projection.The strings are nylon.  They take some work and use to get them seasoned so that they hold a tune.  This is normal, natural and any musician knows this about stringed instruments so keep that in mind before complaining about it going "out of tune".The extra goodies including the case are a very nice touch.  The clip on tuner works great but heed this advice:. If the needle response is a bit slow when tuning it (you'll know what I mean if it happens) just put in a fresh battery.  It takes cr2032 watch batteries they are inexpensive and abundant on amazon.  Buy a pack now and be ahead of the game.I love this little instrument.  Seeing mine broken in it's shipping bag just broke my heart.  Something so sad about seeing a broken instrument.  Take heart though, even if yours arrives in the same state, Amazon has your back.  I also don't blame Ranch for the condition it just looks like it got damaged once it was bagged up.  The one I bought for my son is in perfect order and is dearly loved bed and appreciated.
name: Ken Hasty

HIGHLY RECOMMEND - do not be afraid to buy & trust!

content: I was very surprised at the quality of this 'ukulele.  I have high-end guitars and have seen low priced ukes in the stores, and expected this to be one. But, it is a very, very good instrument. Some commenters complain  it doesn't stay in tune. Mine does.  You have to realize humidity will always crude minor changes. And, of course, new strings on a new instrument - will stretch for a week or so. The tuner is simple, but works perfectly. The case is great too.  Some commenters complain it has loose threads. Mine doesn't. And if it did - I would just have snipped them off and focused on learning how to play the uke.  One comment scored this low because the back was bowed out. It's suppose to be!!

content: I really like this ukalele especially for the price. However I ordered it specifically because it came with a tuner and strap and extra strings. Since those things are included in the price you might as well buy a different instrument and purchase these extras separately. Or if you don't care about getting everything promised you could buy this "kit" as the ukalele itself is perfectly fine (at least for a beginner like me!)

content: Buen articulo.
name: Cándida Acosta

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
short_d: Awesome craftsmanship for a pretty incredible price point.
content: Are you kidding me??? I am so tickled to death with this purchase.  I searched long and hard and read every review on every beginner and concert ukulele and decided to go with this one.  The craftsmanship is really impeccable and the sound coming out of this thing is amazing.  I tried to capture the detail and finish of this ukulele  in the photos I took so I hope the pictures do it justice. Even the inlay around the rim of the guitar is flawless. I honestly don’t know how old they could sell at this price point. And that doesn’t even count the gig bag and tuner, which is awesome by the way.  I’m not a stringed instrument player, so what I cannot tell you the feel of the strings when depressed, like is it hard or not? Being a beginner player, my fingers are freaking killing me right now  because I can’t put this down LOL. But I don’t think that  has anything to do with the guitar. It’s more my death grip trying to go from one cord to the next as a newbie. Seriously folks, you really cannot go wrong with this ukelele. It is a Beautiful looking instrument but they sound to match.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
short_d: Love, love, love my Ranch Ukulele!
content: This is my first ukulele so I have nothing to compare to, but after researching different brands for a while this one was the right price with a beautiful sound. The quality of the instrument is outstanding and the kit is generous. It came with a well constructed protective carrying bag. Also, the Ranch tuner works very well. I just wish the strap was a solid color, like black or dark navy. I am having so much fun learning how to play the ukulele. I played wind instruments and the  piano when I was younger, but always wanted to learn the ukulele or guitar. If you are  a newbie (like me), definitely give yourself time to gradually build up to more difficult songs. It is so easy to try the more difficult tunes, but practicing chords changes and strumming on easy beginner songs is the way to go. Do not hesitate to get this instrument from Ranch. You will not be disappointed.

content: I played acoustic guitar in the past but was never really good at it. I wanted to pick up a stringed instrument again that might be more manageable and this ukulele is perfect. I didn't think I would need the strap but I recommend using it because it helps keep the instrument in place which makes playing easier. I haven't tried the online lessons yet, just been playing by the chord chart that it came with and picking out simple kids songs but look forward to using the lessons soon. It's that easy and fun!

content: Now I’m not experienced when it comes to ukulele but I have pretty good judgement. I’ve actually ordered two of these and the reason for that is that the first one didn’t come with the promised accessories, had a tuning peg that felt off, sharp frets, and a few rough patches on the seams. Now I wanted to give this uke another try simply because the first one didn’t sound bad and I liked the design despite another uke being better rated and reviewed than this one. The second uke that I received came with all the accessories and promised things. I have yet to return either as I still wanted to play the first one while the second was being shipped, but when I put them next to each other I can really tell that quality control isn’t their finest suit as the back of the second one had a more distinct rounding, the frets of the second one were actually sharper than the other, the gig bag of the second had more loose strings that could potentially fall apart, and the battery that was supposed to come with the tuner was missing. I’m not mad at the sound of this ukulele, but I would rather have a better quality uke that would last longer.

For Ranch Ukulele, I think the Concert size will work better with the arched back (not too round) and also Concert size will have a slightly bigger body to help balance the weight of the headstock and full metal gear.The finishing of the Ukulele is smooth and nice.The ukulele has nice low action and great playability.The fretboard is smooth with no sharp edges.The package came with a very nice and quality padded gig bag and everything listed in the product description and photos.Overall it is a nice package for the price and a decent product.

short_d: Great for a beginner like me
content: I studied piano as a child many years ago.  I wanted to return to music but needed a more portable instrument that would not be too difficult to learn.  After a bit of research, I decided to get a ukulele.  The concert type seemed to be a good way to start, being not too big nor too small.  Based on the reviews, I chose this one, and have not been disappointed.  The sound is pleasant.  The case is so convenient.  When I am not playing the ukulele, I store it in its case and hang the case on a door hook.  The tuner that came with it stopped registering the C string after a few days.  I contacted the company, and they quickly sent a new tuner, with no added charge.  This company has great customer service.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
content: This ukulele is definitely designed with beginners in mind, which is why I purchased it.  If I were to be rating it solely for that purpose, its a 5 star review.  However, I feel like there is more that needs to be considered.  The build of the instrument feels extremely cheap and is made in China.  Sure everything is, but just pointing it out.  Out of the box it looks nice and I think it overall is an okay product.  The problem is more so when you really start to play it. The chords need to be tuned over and over and over again which is a disappointing feature.  This is a reflection of the build quality and definitely indicates it is a "cheap" product.  The sound is good enough for beginners when tuned, but that really is not the case for majority of the time you are playing.  The lessons to learn how to play are extremely useful and I believe may be worth the purchase price in the end, but the ukulele definitely is not.  The carrying case is really nice though!Pros:-Great for lessons and beginners learning the instrument for the first time-Nice carrying case-Fairly cheapCons:-Poor quality-Loses tune very easily and needs to be retuned over and over-Not a great strap-Just okay soundIn general, this is a good option to learn with, because not only do you get the lessons, you also learn how to retune your instrument.  I think the price was great, the lessons are worth it, but the ukulele itself is low quality.  You get what you pay for and thats all there is to it.  Below average to okay product.  3 stars

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
content: My first Ukulele ever just arrived today.Last time I played an instrument was in elementary school (I'm 54 now) and it was the French Horn. Just want to say as a child it was very hard to play most notes accurately if at all. My music instructor back then was kind enough to not put me off on my choice of instrument. He instead modified my music sheets to accommodate the notes I could play and for that I still have a desire to learn to play.So with that in mind; I searched the internet for an easier to learn instrument, that's how I got to this point!Lance Allen makes the included online instructions from Ranch seem easy to understand and hopefully that makes it very easy to perform as well!I did not mark anything for ratings about the instrument being for  beginners or easy to learn. Simply because I don't know yet! I have not even tuned the Ukulele yet. However; the quality and craftsmen ship seem very good for this price point. I will note that all the items listed in the kit were included along with two picks as well. Ranch did on the reverse side of the warranty sheet included a quick reference to additional Ukulele notes and chords. The strap that I received fits on the two posts on the body of the Ukulele and goes over the shoulder, more like a traditional guitar strap.I am planning to update this review later, once I have had time to tune and practice my new Ranch Soprano Ukulele.Update: Well I haven’t practiced as much as I hoped! However the Ukulele is very easy to play once I can remember to place my fat rounded fingers on the correct strings. I might suggest that if you have the same issue step up to the next larger sized Ukulele, it should help out a lot. Not to mention prevent a little less learning frustration.
name: R. Baill

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
short_d: Poor craftsmanship - Saddle not installed correctly, problem with string sound, splintering.
content: I was very excited to receive this product, as I’ve been playing a Kala soprano ukulele for a couple months and wanted to upgrade to a concert ukulele. Unfortunately the craftsmanship wasn’t there, something I was expecting to be great due to all the rave reviews. There are a couple prough splinters in the opening of the ukulele (first photo), and the biggest flaw is that the saddle was misaligned! It is not fully into its notch, meaning the A string is completely off of it and flush with the fretboard, with nothing to hold it up. This makes the sound extremely unpleasant - strangely harsh and metallic. I tried to adjust it on my own but the saddle will not budge, and I would prefer not to have to try to destring, adjust, and restring an instrument on my own straight out of its package and risk damaging it when I paid for it and it should come playable. I am pretty disappointed with my purchase. I will plan to return and reorder one more time to give it a second chance, because all the reviews are great, but it was definitely a letdown this time.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
content: So I decided I wanted to learn how to play a ukulele and was doing my research. I I found this ranch one with pretty good reviews and not to expensive(since I have a 3 year old) that I wouldn’t be worried if my kid got a hold of it. date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019
short_d: Great Concert Uke for the Price
content: I am a K-8 music teacher, but still sort of a novice at the ukulele.  I bought this to use in my classroom to accompany students and to use with the students I teach ukulele to. My students have Kala soprano dolphins and sharks. I really wanted a concert in one of those but this Ranch one was cheaper with good ratings, so I thought I would give it a try.  The rounded back has taken some getting used to, and the edges of the frets could be just a tad duller.  However, for the price, this is a great little uke.  It has a nice, warm sound.  The quality is good. It comes with Aquila nylon strings. Be aware that these are great strings for beginners, but you have to tune them every day or two for a couple of weeks before using.  It plays nicely. I’m glad I got it and would recommend it to others.
