name: itzel

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
content: I am new the playing ukulele I've never picked one up until I bought this, so I was not sure what to expect. This ukulele is wonderful! It is gorgeously crafted, with a beautiful color of wood and designs around the sound hole. It has a bright and lovely sound. It did take a few days for the strings to stay in tune, but that happens with all instruments. After having it for a week now, the C string stays in tune after playing and the other three strings are only flat by a small amount, which makes tuning very easy and done in under a minute. The frets are filed down and don't cause a probably when moving my hand up and down the neck. The concert size is very comfortable to hold, even without the use of the strap.It comes with a bag, a strap, a tuner, an extra set of strings, a cloth, and some picks. It also came with a handy sheet that had all of the chords on it. The case is sturdy. It's not hard, but it's not so soft that it won't protect the instrument. it did have a bit of a plastic-y scent but I'm sure that will air out if left out for a few hours. The tuner works just fine and fits nicely onto the head of the ukulele. You can swivel it around and position it so it sits in the best place for you to see while tuning. The strap is okay. I had a hard time getting it onto the pegs on the ukulele. The slit cut into the ends of the strap are a bit tight at first so you really have to force them on. The strap is also on the smaller side. I'm pretty small myself being a 5'3" woman and the strap is close to longest it can get. I don't think anyone much larger than me could use this strap. I haven't had to change the strings yet, but the extra set that comes with is the same brand as the ones on the ukulele, which is one of the best brands to have. The picks are okay. They are thin plastic picks. Felt picks are more common to use since plastic ones can sound too harsh for the ukulele's sound. I haven't used the cloth, but I'm sure it'll do its job just fine.Overall, I would highly recommend this ukulele! It is great for beginners and for more advanced learners as well. It comes with a great assortment of accessories that if bought separately would definitely increase the price.  For $60 (price for the concert size) this is a steal. This would make a great birthday or Christmas gift for anyone interested in learning the ukulele.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
short_d: Good Price/Cost vs Benefit, for beginners/intermediates
content: This is my first Ukulele (Concert size) and no regrets at all. PRICE vs BENEFIT = Ranch UkuleleThe sound is kool, the fretboard is comfortable and stay well tuned, just necessary give the fair time as usual in chords instrument, like a day or two and no more issue.I used to play acoustic guitar before so I tend to be a lit bit exigent here, negative point: I noted after a week using, the string "C"  - the thick one, is producing a "background" vibration in the contact with the saddle. It's something that annoys if you play more intense or hard BUT honestly should not be something noted by others, except by you that creates such "intimacy" with that. Another thing that's cosmetics but guess is good to mention, the silver tuning head are really good however on the back there was few scratches that does not impact in ANY thing but could be avoided with a thin plastic stick (like in a new cellphone screen), since when you buy something new, you're not expected see any marks.As my first Uke I'm fine with that and really recommend, was the best Cost and Benefit I found, it's not amateur neither professional instrument, it's a great first experience.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
content: I've had it almost a week now so I feel I can make a review.  The last ukulele I owned was the epiphone Les Paul sunburst uke and I will definitely say I should have just bought another of those haha this Ranch ukulele is alright for the price, the tuner isn't the greatest (what'd you expect for a $65 bundle?) But has worked fine the 150 or so times I tuned this thing trying to stretch out the strings (took about a day) haha the neck strap is totally pointless because this Ranch concert uke has the strap buttons already for a regular strap.  The wood is a bit too thin perhaps because when I start really playing there's a buzzing vibration that is not the kind you want coming from the body.  I'm guessing there's a piece of the innerbody that didn't get glued in well or something...  So this is a $65 ukulele bundle and you get exactly $65 worth of brand new ukulele and accessories haha

name: Doug Davis

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
content: As a guitar teacher, I'd been asked several times if I'd consider teaching ukulele, so I thought to myself....... then I really should get one. I checked out some reviews and settled on the Ranch Concert Ukulele, and I'm glad I made the decision. There are many bad uke's on the market, not much more than toys, or those that cost an arm and a leg. This one was reasonably priced, stayed in tune well from the offset and had a really nice tone. I'm having a lot of fun with it and will be teaching many of my students with it in the coming months. Whether you're a guitarist or never played a musical instrument before, you won't go wrong with this lovely little uke. So much fun!

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
content: Wanted a tenor to play around with low G tuning, and at this price why not?I was pleasantly surprised by the looks.  It's nice looking.  Curved back on this one not what I expected, but it looks ok.Sound wasn't bad, about what you would expect at this price.  So a little plasticy and harsh (only a little, and again, no more than is usual for this price.)The nut was a bit high.  As was the bridge saddle.  So action was a little high.  And both parts we're plastic and not worth the effort.  So I ordered an ebony nut and saddle set and WOW!  Once the ebony nut and saddle we're installed and adjusted this little inexpensive Uke really opened up and sounds beautiful.  With the addition of the low G string, it's exactly what I wanted.  And it only cost a few dollars (and 20 to 30 minutes of easy work).I'm also going to replace the tuning machines.  The ones that came on it are serviceable, but tuning machines are a bit of a pet peeve for me, and a set of uke Grover sta-tites are only $13.  So why wouldn't i?I came to Uke fron guitar because FUN!  With inexpensive guitars, it's common to get a new guitar and need to make a few adjustments and upgrade the couple parts that annoy you.  It's part of the fun. The secret is finding one with a good, straight body and neck.  In other words, decent bones.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
content: This Ranch concert ukulele instrument kit is a great deal. I already have a few higher end ukes from Hawaii but wanted to get a nice starter kit for my teen niece who is just starting to play. With this kit you get everything you need to start playing out of the box —a tuner, a strap, Aquila strings, a better quality gig bag and 12 free online lessons. The uke itself is a real beauty. Looks and feels like something you’d see in a uke that costs twice as much. Not only is it nice to look at, but the edges are seamless and the smooth fretboard is comfortable to play. It’s easy to tune and has a nice sound. I accidentally ordered the concert size instead of the tenor, and she wants a tenor. That’s the only reason I’m returning this beauty. Still, I’m turning right around and ordering the tenor uke because I’m sold on Ranch craftsmanship. I’ve looked around and played other brands and have found that Ranch ukes are ahead of other ukes’ quality at this price point.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018
short_d: It has almost perfect intonation and it holds the note steady.
content: I've bought and returned a bunch of ukuleles because they had bad intonation (strings in tune when open, but sharp when fretted, resulting in sour sounding chords).I played over 20 ukuleles in shops including a $400 Fender and this is better than all of them.Plus, on other ukuleles, when you tune a string, the frequencies bounce all over the place without you touching the tuning knobs or the string. It makes it hard to tune them.  On this ukulele, the tone holds rock steady.

content: I bought this for personal use to learn to play. I like the quality of sound from this uke. It has a resonance and depth that sounds good to me. It only took 3 days for it to start staying in tune. I played every day from the lessons available at ranchguitar.com and others on YouTube. Unfortunately, after 3 weeks the C string developed a buzz. The folks at Ranch responded quickly to my email about the problem. They suggested several things for me to try to stop the buzz; but it appears that there may be a problem with the nut. They promptly sent me a replacement ukulele kit which arrived within a few days. In spite of the buzzing string I give this uke 5 stars because the service from Ranch Guitar was so good.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2018
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. A small story of how I found the Ranch Ukulele.  I am a high school teacher of 30+ years and for the first time ever am facilitating several independent studies classes. One young man selected the music industry careers as his topic for the semester. I asked if he played an instrument and his response of "no, but I want to" started a group quest to find what might work for him. Fairly soon I was working with half a dozen students wanting to try the Ukulele.  One of the young men said he know someone who could play and would ask him to come to teach some of the basics.  He agreed and the quest for instruments began.After several days of research, begging family and friends to help, we finally received a couple of classroom instruments.  One teacher, six students, and 2 ukuleles make learning next to impossible.  One of the girls told me she found the ukulele she was going to get for class. Her eagerness to share the find caused me to slow down and take a look. She had actually found a ukulele that was not too expensive and looked a lot better than the "toy" ones she first wanted.  I agreed to order it for her and she could pay me back in installments. Fast-forward to now, I also learned that the young man who was teaching us had a bumper sticker on the back of his ukulele that covered the rather large crack which happened when he either dropped it or his sister sat on it. He liked the Tenor size because of his "sausage fingers" and the sound, so I ordered THIS Ranch Tenor with him in mind.I wish I would have recorded his first reaction to this Ukulele. He was very surprised to find out how much I paid and kept reinforcing his Hawaiian ukulele was three times that amount. HE LOVED THE SATIN FINISH because he has sweaty hands and the high gloss varnish causes a slippery grip.  His praise of the Ranch ukulele has not stopped since the first day I let him play it.  Ukulele fever is spreading and I believe we have found one of the BEST Beginner Ukuleles Amazon has to offer.Hope the videos convey the quality in construction, the sound, and the fun of play.
name: Tommie J Barkley

I've wanted to start learning an instrument for a while and I feel like this was the best way to do it!The Ukulele was packaged securely so everything arrived without a scratch. After admiring the craftsmanship for several minutes, I dove right in and used the online lessons (FREE!) to start learning. Before starting, I was about as musically illiterate as a person can be, two weeks later I can already play three songs! I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it's been to learn: from tuning the Ukulele (tuning device included with kit), to learning chords, to stinging them all together (pun not intended) into a song; it's been a joy. Buy this, use the online lessons, learn a new skill. You won't regret it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2018
short_d: Good Value. Good Looks.  Good Tone. Intonation a Tiny Bit Off
content: Great Value ($60 kit)Fit and finish is very nice.  Finish is natural - Satin gloss (barely glossy).  Decorative details on the headstock and around the sound hole are laser etched.  Neck seemed to be fine and all notes up and down fret board were good with no buzz. The rounded back is nice and makes it just a little more comfortable to hold.I am pleased with the sound. No serious complaints.Intonation: Intonation was off. Would not be noticeable to most people.  All four strings played slightly sharp at the 12th fret. For you newbies, intonation means the instrument should play the same note Open as when you press the 12th fret. This should give the same note but up one octave.Recommend loosening strings and putting a tiny bit of vaseline in the string slots of the nut.  It tunes much better and the strings don't "pop" as yo try to tune them.It was supposed to be a "kit" with various accessories, but I did not get the tuner, strap, strings.  Amazon made it good and I ordered theses things separately at no cost to me.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
content: I feel a bit petty, posting a two-star review of an instrument that cost me less than $60; I was not expecting the quality of an instrument with a three- or four-figure price tag. Nor was I expecting quality accessories (although the tuner appears to be as accurate and user-friendly as my Snark tuner). That said, several of the claims made in the listing proved to be incorrect (this review is of the tenor-size instrument).APPEARANCE: I was aware that I would not be receiving something that looks like a high-end instrument; the listing photos clearly showed that the fretboard ends bluntly above the soundhole rather than being radiused around it, and that I would need to add my own top-dots if I wanted them on the fretboard. But the first thing I noticed when unboxing was a huge blemish on the face of the instrument (see photo) This isn’t something I would expect to see on a $29.99 instrument, let alone one costing twice that. The ukulele had a quality-control sticker on it; they must have applied it with their eyes closed.DAMAGED STRINGS: All new ukuleles require frequent retuning as, even with frequent playing and retuning, the strings will stretch over the first week or two. To hasten this process, I will run a finger under each string to gently lift and stretch it as I am tuning and, while doing this, I felt a rough spot on the “C” string. Close inspection showed the face of the string was gouged (see photo). The instrument comes with spare strings, but you shouldn’t have to change them immediately.ROUGH FRETS: In at least two places the listing stresses the fret finishing. Here’s one quote: “The nickel silver frets are all properly seated and well finished. For anyone familiar with guitars and stringed instruments, fret ends can be a very troubling point of contact with inexpensive instruments. BUT, these frets have been manicured to a level that there is no sensation whatsoever.” On the instrument I received, that was simply not true. The fret ends were very rough and even jagged in some places (see photo). I spent 30 minutes with a file, correcting this.MISLEADING MATERIALS LISTING: In one spot, the listing stresses the acoustic superiority of sapele (a less expensive variety of mahogany) to laminate, which surprised me, as I would not expect solid wood in an inexpensive instrument. Here’s a quote: “An acoustic instrument body fashioned from Sapele exhibits a pleasingly warmer and deeper tone than laminate wood.”Upon unboxing, I tapped on the top and it sounded like laminate, rather than solid wood. Close examination of the wood at the sound hole confirmed this, showing the layers of a laminate (see photo) and not solid wood. I was not surprised by this, but the listing text may make less experienced buyers believe that they are receiving a solid-top instrument. That is simply not true.I bought this tenor ukulele to have an expendable instrument that I could keep at my office, so my better instruments could stay safe at home. Even at that, I should probably return it and get something else, but that would waste more time and, besides, I am now well into the prep work (leveling frets, etc.) to get it ready to play. Still, as inexpensive as it was, I feel ripped off. Given the blemishes and poor quality control, it appears to me that I paid $59.99 for an instrument that is worth less than half that. Save your money, spend a little more and get a Kala or something like that, and you will be happier in the long run.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2018
short_d: No reason to buy anything more expensive unless you're a professional; a fun new experience for guitar players
content: This thing is great!  It's really brought music back into my life.  It was delivered within 5 days, and arrived in excellent condition.  The finish is a nice matte wood that doesn't look toy-ish at all.  The detail around the opening is nice, it doesn't look cheap at all.  I don't feel weird playing it as a grown woman.  The tuner is adorably tiny and very accurate, I just leave it clamped to the end of the uke.  The kit also includes a dust/polish cloth, a second set of strings, and two picks.For someone who already plays guitar, picking up the ukelele is easy!  With about 6 hours of practice over the last few days I've already built up a small repertoire of 10 or so songs I can sing and strum along with.  My fingertips are blistering on my left hand -- being out of practice, my calluses are starting over.  But even with sore fingertips, the plastic strings are playable -- no need to take a day off to let them recover.  In a week or so I'll be properly callused.  I've never played on anything but steels before so this is a new and, I admit, very pleasant experience!Unlike a guitar, a uke is played where the neck meets the body of the guitar.  When played correctly. this little guy has a bright and clear sound, with enough volume to carry over a small group of friends, although perhaps not in front of a crowd.  Its sound can be both delicate and robust.  Who would have thought 4 plastic strings could be as engaging and full of depth as a steel 6 string?Six months ago I broke my right arm, making playing my dreadnaught-sized acoustic guitar nearly impossible.  I just couldn't get it my arm around the body to strum, but I also didn't want to shell out the money for a decent 3/4 size guitar.  So instead I invested $55 in this little guy.  It fits right into the crook my arm, which saves me from having to rotate the broken area.  I strum with my wrist rather than my elbow, which really eases a lot of the tension.  Having had a steel plate installed in my upper arm, I wonder if I will ever have the dexterity to handle a full-sized guitar ever again.  But with this little uke in my life, it doesn't seem so bad!Short of needing a louder instrument in order to perform in front of a live audience, or just collector's pride, I don't see why anyone would need a more expensive instrument than this.  Not only is the ukelele itself worth every penny, but you get the gig bag, tuner, strings, and picks to go with it.  This is a terrific bargain and one that you will not regret.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
content: The uke arrived well packaged, with all the goodies listed. I was expecting it to be average sound-wise, given the cost. I was wrong! The bell-like tones that came out of this instrument when I first plucked the strings were quite a surprise. And I do mean bell-like. Im a beginner at ukulele, so my strumming and finger placement isnt all that good, but that doesnt seem to matter with this uke. The tones are rich and full, not tinny and plinky. I signed up for a uke class by accident and then figured "what the heck", I can try it just for fun.  This ukulele has made the class much easier for me. The instructor suggested a tenor uke because I have large hands, and I knew I wouldnt be able to play a little one. It is a perfect fit. The class has turned out to be fun and easy. We are playing all those funny songs we sang as kids--She'll be Coming round the mountain, Aint gonna rain no more, Skip to ma Lou--fun stuff. Since this ukulele is easy to play, Im able to focus on the hysterical lyrics of some of those songs! Its a HOOT!

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2018
short_d: A great value for a very fine Tenor uke!
content: This is a wonderful kit to buy as a beginner, intermediate or "beach/camping" ukulele player who wants to try a tenor size uke.  I have been playing a concert-sized Cordoba 15CM for the past couple of years and I love the sound and quality of that instrument, but wanted to try the slightly larger size of a tenor ukulele.  I did a lot of research and the Ranch product received enough rave reviews that I figured I'd try it. It has turned out to greatly exceed my expectations in all respects.Pros:  - great quality construction  - the wood and polish look very rich and don't look cheap at all  - keeps in tune  - fullyw enclosed all-metal tuning gears  - includes Aquila nylgut strings (these make all the difference in sound and play)  - frets are well placed, smooth, and the right height for fast chording  - the slightly rounded back helps make the sound rich and quite loud without sounding tinny or cheapCons: - the included tuner device is okay, but not great... I use my KLIQ Ubertuner instead (it's great!)  - I don't usually use a strap when playing, but I found that the included strap is just okay for holding the instrument, if you want to use a strap at all.  - This Ranch tenor uke weighs only about an ounce heavier than my concert sized Cordoba, even though it's 3 inches longer and the center of gravity is about an inch further up the neck than the Cordoba concert uke.  It feels a little "neck heavy" to me because the body is so light, but I got adjusted pretty easily to this.All in all, I think this is a great sounding, high quality, easy to play ukulele that I'm happy to use for pretty much any purpose and proud to take to jam sessions.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
short_d: A beautiful sounding and looking arched back ukulele
content: I purchased this ukulele because at the time, the product photos showed a rich, coffee brown color, but when it arrived it was much lighter. It also came without the advertised strap buttons and there was some light cosmetic damage to the headstock, but only visible if you looked hard.Luckily, Ranch customer service is good. They responded quickly and to their credit, updated their product photos to reflect the color of the instrument more accurately the day I contacted them. They offered to make things right by sending me a new one immediately, but the color was important to me and the deeper brown color was only available in the first production batch, so I didn't end up keeping it.I've handled dozens of ukuleles before and I have to say, the build quality on this Ranch Concert ukulele is -superb-. All the little details are taken care of. The fret edges are very smooth, fretboard is flawless, binding is perfect, etc. There were no blemishes on the finish and no gaps in pieces of wood joined together like there are in many other models I've seen.This is a beautiful sounding and looking arched back ukulele and the kit has everything you need. I liked the gray bag and the tuner is easy to use and works well. Not that I had to use it much. The included Supernylgut Aquila strings settle in after only a day or so, and there's even an extra set.
name: Kiwi F.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
short_d: Affordable and Sounds just as Good as name Brands
content: My Thoughts:I purchased this a while ago to accompany a 26 Professional. Now that I have had some time with it I felt ready to share some things. First, I do think you get a lot more your money. The 21 inch is slightly smaller than I’m used to but it still played some happy tunes.The Brand is “Ranch,” and this is the UK-21 Soprano kit.  You get everything you need to get started and learn how to play…so good for a beginner and also for someone who already plays. The Soprano model of course is much smaller that a Concert Ukulele hence the 21 inches.  The sound difference between a Soprano is that it’s the loudest, brightest sound out of the 3(Concert,Tenor). I think that when people think of a Ukulele they think of a Soprano. the smaller one.The finish is nice but not as good as a $100+ Martin Ukulele. There is a difference and it’s the wood…this one just uses cheaper wood. Not that big of a deal though because it still sounds great. In fact, it basically sounds the name as more expensive name brands.The last thing I would say is that if you are an adult looking to buy your 1st Ukulele I would probably go with a Concert size so it is not as awkward to handle, but for a kid the Soprano would be on point.The Bottom Line:I can’t tell the difference in sound between this Ukulele and a Martin. If you are just looking for something fun with loud, bright sound, you will be happy.

content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. What an amazing value for a great Tenor Uke!.We have another Ukulele in our family that we also purchased on Amazon and I was in the mood for one to play with my son who is the owner of the 'other Uke'.  I did a little research and picked this one.  For $69 you get a tenor Ukulele with a nice gig bag, with a spare set of strings and a tuner.  We paid more for my son's Uke with less stuff and they seem to be of similar build quality.(See photos).I'm not a professional musician.  I do play guitar and have always wanted to Uke to kick around on, there's a lot less to worry about when sitting around a camp fire or just outside having fun with friends when you're handling a sub $100 instrument.What an amazing value for a great Tenor Uke!.I was really impressed with the build quality, again reference the photos.  The finish on the bridge isn't perfect, but the body is great, the neck is straight, the action is low and better than expected.  The tuners though, well they are just a tad on the cheap side and are my only complaint.  Still, what a great value, you cannot go wrong with this Ukulele.Note: This is a larger Tenor Uke, check the photos for a comparison with the other soprano Ukulele.I have also included a snippet video of my son playing this so you can get a feel for how it sounds.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
short_d: Excellent Concert Ukulele.  You won't regret this purchse!
content: We have several Ukulele's at our home.  My oldest daughter has a Kala we purchased in Kauaii while on vacation ($100), my second daughter has a starter/kids diamond head soprano ukulele she purchased years ago on Amazon ($35) and a Lanika concert ukulele ($90 pictured below).  After comparing this ukulele to our others we came up with the conclusion that we could have saved a lot of money by purchasing this ukulele vs the others.  While the tenor ukulele has been excellent, it came solo (no extras) and cost a lot of money, the Lanika (again no extras) has beautiful sound quality and both are great ukuleles, but in my opinion this Ranch ukulele is just as quality as the others we own for half the cost!  The sound quality is absolutely beautiful, and the color of the wood is stunning as is the entire look of the ukulele.  The gig bag it comes with is padded and far superior to the bag we purchased separately for our Lanika.  My daughter has now stolen my bag and claimed it as her own.  I also love that it comes with a neck strap for when you want to play standing up (already used that feature several times).  The extra strings and polishing cloth are nice additions as is the tuner.  Thus far the tuner has worked perfectly every time we have tuned it.  Now my youngest daughter is begging for her own ukulele, and this will be the one we purchase again!  I couldn't be more pleased with this beautiful instrument!  Thank you Ranch and amazon for providing such excellent quality products at affordable prices!

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2017
content: I was looking for an inexpensive ukelele to add to a collection that I take to family Christmas where we have a big singalong/playalong. What a pleasant surprise when I opened the box and found this uke which not only looks great, but also sounds great, too. It comes strung with Aquila strings and has a spare set of strings, a polishing cloth, electronic tuner, strap, and a nice looking, sturdy gig bag. The instrument itself is very pretty, with nicely done, open pore finish and a laser etched design around the sound hole. The neck is straight and has low action, and the fret wires are well finished with no sharp edges. It has a nice, clear tone with plenty of sustain, and plays true at the 12th fret. I have much more expensive ukuleles that don't sound as good as this one does. This would be a great gift for a beginning ukulele player, and would be a good addition to the collection of a more experienced player. At this price, the additional items enclosed and the quality of the uke itself make this a terrific bargain!

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2017
short_d: Imagine my surprise when my soon to be prized possesion arrived packaged in a disgusting shipping box barely held by the copious amounts of ...
content: I was very excited for this product. Imagine my surprise when my soon to be prized possesion arrived packaged in a disgusting shipping box barely held by the copious amounts of tape meant to hold it together. The product itself was partially broken, with the Ukelele rattling from a chipped off piece of wood. Something else seems to be off with the way it makes music. It's a nice instrument in concept but I'm very disappointed in the service provided.Edit: they've offered to replace the damaged one I recieved, and I'm moving my eating rating from 2 stars to 3 due to the swiftness of their actions and their willingness to fix their mistakes. Once I receive the replacement, I will update again.Okay I got the replacement. Much better shipping conditions, and I was happy to see the bus it shipped in didn't look like it had just come from a dumpster. This Uke is not broken, and consequently works much better. I have raised my score from 3 to 4 stars.
name: Lys

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017
content: When tuned the ukulele needs to be tuned again after a few minutes. I wish I can return for a refund because I got tired of tuning and don't use it anymore.
name: Gapo City

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2017
short_d: Cow-boy this is a decent ukulele
content: This is a really good concert ukulele for the price. I have a lanikai soprano ukulele and the sound that comes from it is comparable, if not a little better. The sounds that comes out of the ukulele is warm and a bit deep. Having aquila definitely helps makes the sound that comes out of it resonate warmly. The construction is also well done, with the fret boards surprisingly smooth on the sides.The order also comes with a couple other goodies. There's a tuner that works well enough, and it's always nice to have a physical tuner rather than using my phone. There's a strap which I haven't quite figured out how to use and set up with the ukulele. There's an extra pair of aquila strings in case you break a string, although unlikely, is still really nice. There's also a case which is well made and fits all the things inside well.For any ukulele, the string will have to be tuned multiple times until it gets used to the ukulele and your playing so this is normal. I found it stayed in tune a little longer than normal out of the box which is nice.The only con I found was the micro fiber cloth. It was useless as the triangular shaped corners started fraying and coming apart. However since it's a bonus anyways it's not a big deal. The price for all of this when I got it was 54 bucks which is a great deal! It's cheaper than my soprano ukulele.
name: X. Dong

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2017
content: Love this Uke starter set.The Uke is gorgeous and doesn't feel cheap - sounds great.The bag it comes with is lined fabric and not cheap vinyl.  The handles on the bag are nice - for hand carry or sling carry.The tuner is ok...better than not having one.  However, I just use the tuner app on my phone before I pull the tuner out that came with the set.You will have to tune the strings very frequently the first few weeks of playing - as you usually have to do with all uke strings.  I've been playing it for a month and I still have to tune it during play.Overall I think it's a pretty good value and I shopped around for quite a while before I chose this one.

content: for my wife she likes it...
name: mike lang

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2017
short_d: I just received my sweet little tenor uke
content: So, I just received my sweet little tenor uke. It is adorable, looks nice feels nice, it came with strings however they were very loose & not tuned, being just a hobby strummer, I was a little afraid to tune it up. Got it tuned, I think the strings need a little stretching to hold the tune, which is normal. It sounds beautiful & I'm excited to be playing it. I now love it! My big and only issue for now (and I have since updated my review) is that the strap that is included, was confusing and didnt look like the correct product as it didn't apear to have a place to attach to the uke. When I bought it there weren't pics on how to use it,  it is not a "guitar" strap. The seller was very attentive and helpful with how to use the strap and has since updated the description and pictures so there is no confusion on how to use the strap. Therefore you may want to look elsewhere for a real guitar strap to use with traditional pegs. However its a sweet uke a great value. Still excited to play this cutie and since the purchase still love playing it. Purchased in a few months ago & still love it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
content: I'm a complete beginner. I originally got interested when one of my best friends started to run a Ukelele Club at school and let us borrow ukeleles during the club meetings. They handed out a bunch of these specific ukeleles and I wanted to try on my own at home so I just bought it. (Side note* the club had about 12 of these and all 12 sounded amazing and there were no differences in their sound or structure). Throughout the course of my young uke's life, I've moved twice and my poor uke had to be squished at times, but it made it through without anything broken or any sound changes. At the start, you do have to tune it a lot, but that's normal, after a while of playing and strumming the strings a lot, the uke stays in tune for some solid days.

My brother is a guitar teacher and said that this was a good brand choice for me.  Can't wait until I'm playing it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
short_d: Great beginner uke, craftsmanship could be improved slightly
content: I just got this ukulele yesterday, and I reeeally liked it from the start. It feels really good to play: the neck is smooth, I don’t have to press down so hard on the frets and it actually has kept its tuning quite well already. I also like it’s sound; it has that classic ukulele sound, it’s clear and it’s loud.However, I found that the more I practice/play the songs I know that involve a lot of use of the first and second frets, I notice the gold finish of those frets slowly coming off, showing where I usually play/put my fingers on. I know this is only a beginner ukulele, and I love the other aspects this uke has, and considering the price I can’t complain too much. However, it would be nice to have a uke that keeps its color in the frets, especially after less than a day of playing it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
short_d: Who knew I had this talent?
content: I got this today and practiced for about 3 hours total. I found it really easy to pick up- they have short, clear videos explaining each chord, and the guitar hero style really helps for practicing a new song. I worked on "Over a Rainbow" most of the day and am almost able to play it at it's natural speed. I'm still working on coordinating up strokes and down strokes, but I'm excited about how quickly I'm able to at least pretend I know what I am doing. I have a little bit of violin and piano experience, but I don't feel like that helped me much- I think this instrument and are accessible to almost anyone. Idk yet if this is to be expected of any ukelele, but the tips of my fingers definitely hurt from holding down the strings.

name: Travis F Fletcher

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
short_d: Think: "Ram On", by Sir Paul, when he was still McCartney MBE
content: Have you seen the Stars tonight? This cool little instrument, when utilized with a decent harmonica; a Jaw's harp; and a kazoo should enable you (after a bit of practice) to support yourself as a New Orleans street busker. I do not advise you to move to NOLA, but you probably could. Oh, try to determine if you have any talent, and jack-up your determination. Who knows? Anything is possible. At least, you would have the tools to be a "Star".Seriously, this uke is a great deal for beginners or those who play guitar, but want to double on ukulele. Also, it is a great travel instrument, except on a commercial airplane. Never travel with any instrument on a commercial flight. Yet, it is a wonderful instrument to take in your car, on a train, on a boat, on a cycle (bi or motor). Nothing is cooler than  uke-playing Harley rider.
name: Axis, Bold as Love,Top Contributor: Classic Rock

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
content: I bought this for a friend's son as a gift.  I've played guitar for fifteen years, but never uke.  After receiving the item I spent a day fooling around with it before giving it my friend's son (mostly to test it and make sure no issues).  Honestly, I can't believe how good it was for the price.  I mean you won't be playing a venue with this thing, but to teach yourself some chords and get yourself playing music, what a buy!  I'm considering getting myself one just to be able to grab and take places when I don't feel like bringing a full-size guitar.

short_d: A purchase you will be glad you made!
content: I was interested in starting my 10 yr old daughter on an instrument. Someone I was making small talk with said the Ukulele was an excellent choice for the following reasons:1. inexpensive upfront cost- totally affordable.2. there are only 4 strings on a Ukulele- a good place for little hands to start learning to read & play music.3. the Ukulele is small and perfect if you live in an apartment or small dwelling.4. very low maintenance/upkeep, only tuning. and this item provides a free tuning app!5. listening to your child practice won’t make you want to blow your brains out.6. the Ukulele is totally cool! and you can take it anywhere!Needless to say, my child was hooked right away! It is SO NICE to have her thoroughly enjoy something that doesn’t require a charging cable or WiFi.P.S. The person who recommended to me said to make sure the Ukulele is 1.) made of real wood and 2.) has real strings (not plastic) which this one does!

I've gotten a ukelele for less money than this and it was still better.I wouldn't get this for someone who is trying to learn because they would never play it in tune, especially if they had no ear for it. date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
content: I had ordered a ukelele of a different brand for myself, but my stepson liked it so much I decided to give it to him and order a new one. I wanted to try a different brand for comparison, and the reviews were great on Kala, so decided to give it a try. I thought I had ordered the exact same size, but the Kala is quite a bit smaller than I was expecting. The sound is nice, but it is extremely light weight, almost like a toy. After playing it, I decided it would be a better fit for my stepson, since he is 8 and he agreed-he likes it much better. The other one I purchased also came with a lot more to the kit, a tuner and strap, and the carrying case is a real case, not just a bag to hold it in. It's a nice learning uke and has a good sound to it, but I probably would not purchase again.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019
short_d: Poor craftsmanship, bridge broke from body after 3 months of light use
content: I really enjoyed the Kala App and learning Uke.  The issue came about when in the middle of the night I heard a loud snap and woke up to find that bridge of the Uke had broken off from the Uke body.  Whatever cheap glue they had used wasn't strong enough so the strings literally pulled the bridge entirely off using just their tension (see photo)! Ridiculous.  I did not over tighten the strings (I always used the Kala App tuner to adjust the tension) and also if I had over tightened, then the string itself should have snapped, the bridge should never bust off the body!  Absolutely poor craftsmanship, I would not recommend at all.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2019
short_d: Thought I got a dud but it turns out my E and A strings were tuned an octave too low
content: This is our first uke- I bought it for my daughter and instantly fell in love. I've never played a stringed instrument before so I'm excited to venture into this new world. I've already ordered another uke for myself so we don't have to share but I went with a concert size for me.HELPFUL INFO FOR THOSE BRAND NEW TO THIS- IF YOU ARE TUNED BUT IT STILL DOESN'T SOUND RIGHT: I knew I was going to have to tune it so we did and thought all was well. What I couldn't figure out was that all of the strings were in tune but the E and A strings were vibrating a lot and seemed to play very low. Being a noob I was afraid to keep cranking up the tension so I refrained until I finally found an answer in the Q&A on here that someone else had a similar issue and their string was tuned an octave too low, so away I turned. This ended up fixing the issue and now this little uke sings beautifully.

content: I recently bought another (more expensive) uke - Lohana - and this Kala is vastly better. It has a rich, mellow resonance that actually sounds more like my Eastman that cost 5x as much. The finish on the fretboard is perfect, with smooth beveled edges on the fretwires. It’s easy to play, stays in tune and has great volume. I agree with other reviewers that the software isn’t of much help. It wants me to pay more to subscribe. Get a clip-on tuner, which is more accurate and easy to use. I bought this for my granddaughter and now I am considering buying another. There are a lot of ukuleles in the beginner price tange but this is really special.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
short_d: Great beginners uke without breaking the bank!
content: This is a wonderful beginners instrument! Comes with a little beginners guide booklet and drawstring bag. I didn't know anything about ukuleles when I bought it, only looked at the reviews and knew I didn't want to pay more than $100. A simple plywood body and plastic strings. Tbh Ive had it for a bit over 2 years and haven't felt the need to change the strings for they hold their tune very well still (okay okay maybe I should do so soon). I wish it came with a more protective gig bag like many other ukes do, but I guess that's what paying an extra $30-40 gets you. Quite pleased with this Kala uke. 10/10 recommend for any music-enthusiast who wants to give ukulele a go without feeling regrets about paying too much!

name: Calen

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2019
short_d: Fun instrument. Difficult to tune. App is a little misleading.
content: Got this for our daughter for Christmas. It is decently constructed and comes with a thin, soft carrying case (wouldn’t count on it for protection).We downloaded the app and got to tuning it - this proved to be a long process (initially) as the built-in tuner as it didn’t seem to calibrate correctly - telling us to tune up & down with large changes for the same string. We abandoned that and tuned by ear and then went back to the app to fine tune. It seemed to work better then.Once in the app, all the “instructions” and “lesson” are links to YouTube videos for chords, strumming, etc.She has shown interest in playing with the Ukulele as a fun activity, from time to time, so we hope it is something that will inspire her going forward.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
content: I'm completely new to the ukulele and bought it on a whim. I own a couple of guitars and let me tell you, this little uke has completely stolen the show and my heart!The tone is absolutely beautiful, and the body appears to be well-made. The frets are a little rough on the sides of the neck but that's a barely noticeable flaw in an otherwise well-made body.This uke is so enjoyable to play that a friend of mine decided to purchase one immediately after playing mine for a few minutes! It really does provide a beautiful sound and is so easily playable that my six year old niece was able to pick up a few chords.The strings do go out of tune easily initially, as mentioned by other reviewers, but that's only until they've been given time to stretch. I've had my uke for a little over a week and it's already holding tune well.I'd definitely recommend to anyone looking to start playing the ukulele without too steep an investment, it's a quality instrument at quite a bargain price.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
content: I don’t usually review but this was THE Best Buy ever. It was beautiful out of the box. I got a tuner to go with it and tuned it up first thing. Easy Peasy! I have been learning all day. My fingers are a little sore, but they are happy sore. I have read other reviewers upset with the Uke going out of tune so fast. I did not have this problem. I stretched the strings a little before playing and I practiced for about 2 hours. I checked the tune then and it was just a little off. I would recommend this for anyone who is new to playing a ukulele to try this one. The price point is great for a newbie. I might even go for the concert size next time.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2018
content: This is a beautiful Ukulele. It has an amazing sound and quality to it. It holds a tune really well. The app that comes with the Ukulele is also amazing! If you don't understand how to tune by ear, you don't need to because the app has a tuner. Even physical tuners that I have bought do not compare to the app tuner. The chord book is useful for beginners, who don't want to constantly google chords. The bag is what you would expect, it isn't anything special but the strap on it is good.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2018
short_d: Don't bother with the tuner app - otherwise, a great buy.
content: The app is extremely frustrating to use and I bought an external tuner. It cannot hear the two middle string notes appropriately, but tunes the outer two strings perfectly. The quality of the kit is excellent and I do recommend it, as long as you go outside of Kala for your tuner needs. If there is another beginner ukulele you are looking at and the app is causing you to lean toward this one, don't let it be the reason you get the Kala.

content: The frets are in the wrong place. I have tuned the ukulele strings (G, C, E, A) but when I go to play a chord, the notes in the chord are all too flat or sharp. When I have the C string tuned to C and I press on the second fret to create a D, the D pitch is very flat. The only reason I can think of why this is happening is, that the frets are placed incorrectly. The spacing between the frets are off and it creates dissonant pitches. Very disappointed.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2018
short_d: Misleading bundle - came without item and lack quality
content: The ukulele is okay; I got a bit irritated because I chose this one for the accessories (tuner, bag). Came without the tuner and the "soft case" is literally just a sack... returning and ordered Kala KA-15S instead. This is my review for that uke:I bought the starter kit by Kala and liked the uke but I had opted to get it partly for the tuner. It was missing from the package so I found tuning apps (and YouTube by ear) which is effective and realized a tuner isn't necessary. I decided to try the Kala KA-15S since it kept coming up everywhere as the best for a beginner and works well into the intermediate stages... That intrigued me since I'm learning to play quite quickly. It's not only a beautiful instrument, the sound also carries further and is much more distinct than the uke in the starter kit. Not to mention... The case that came with the starter kit was just a flimsy sack. This uke came with a beautiful, soft (quality!) case. I'm so happy I decided to return the other and try this one. Hope this helps!

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2018
content: This is a great little kit if they told everything to expect after you received it.Shipping was better than expected,  it showed up a day early and it was nicely packed and its a great looking ukulele with a really nice sound.BUUUUT!! What they don't tell you about the kit is that the app is only helpful for only 4 days... on a trial period.  I'm not sure what happens after that but I'll find out in 3 more days. And unfortunately the videos with the app don't explain finger placement or how to strum or pluck so it's hard to tell what you're supposed to do.  I found more help searching YouTube for tutorials and skipping the app.AAANND!! The free lessons are only free for two months, but to sign up you have and provide a credit card.  They surely don't mention that in the description either.  To continue lessons after the two months is up you have to pay a monthly fee so now you have to remember to cancel the deal or you get chargedThese two "FREE" items are what sold me on this in the first place. I'm disappointed that none of this is explained in the description at all.Make your purchase choice wisely!!

I downloaded a separate tuner app on google store that is much easier to use. Learn the chords for C,  G,  F,  and Am to get yourself started.  I first learned I'm Yours by Jason Mraz and easily picked up playing from there.  Great little uke! I was just a bit disappointed in the so called "beginners kit". date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2018
content: I ordered the Kala Ukulele Starter.  Overall the package is excellent.  The Ukulele fit and finish is very good.  It is a bit challenging to keep tuned, but perhaps this will improve over time as the string stretch.  There is a small songbook which is helpful, but the best of all is the app that comes along with the package.  It enables you to tune the Ukulele as well as has a lot of songs that you can play and the app has the cords and music that you can play along with and it tells you how well you are doing so that you can track your progress.  The disappointing aspect of the kit is the case.  The case is made up of a paper cloth type of material.  It is flimsy and probably won't last very long.  Overall it is an excellent kit and Ukulele for beginners.  The sound is clear, with no buzzing.  It lacks the depth and richness of the more expensive models.  I would suggest getting this Ukuleleso that you can try it and if you don't enjoy playing the Ukulele you will not have lost hundreds of dollars.

short_d: GREAT Ukulele For All Ages & Skill Levels, Amazing Sound Quality, Awesome Accessories, Highly Recommend
content: I bought this ukulele as a Christmas gift for my sister, a first time player, and wow, I couldn't be happier with the quality! I own a Luna ukulele, and as a gift, a Luna uke was a bit out of my price range. I loved the look of this ukulele when I saw it on Amazon, and had heard of the brand Kala before, so I decided to buy it. Not only did my sister fall in love with the look of this cute ukulele, but she also loved all of the things it came with. She was happy about the tote bag, and thought the song book with chords and the free tuning app were all helpful. We now play together, and I really cannot tell the difference in sound quality between our ukuleles, even though mine was $100 more. I highly recommend this ukulele for a beginning, or even a long time uke player! For the price and quality, I don't think I could have gotten a better deal!

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
content: I got this as my first ukulele, since I didn’t want to invest a lot of money initially.  It sounds and looks great!  I’m very happy with it.  The tuner app is OK, but I got an inexpensive clip-on tuner that I think is handier.  Also got “The Daily Ukulele (365)” book which I have found to serve my needs better than the online lessons.
name: David F.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
short_d: "You get what you pay for" just isn't true here.
content: I've never played before and I got this guy based on all the good recommendations and reviews floating around out there. I still didn't have very high hopes because "you get what you pay for" is almost always true. But I love mine so far. After a few days of playing with it, stretching the strings, and tuning it's holding a tune longer and longer. It sounds lovely. If I'm honest I even like tuning it lol. That was my first order of business this morning; I got out of bed and started messing with it. It's such a sweet little instrument and everyone in the house has played with it a bit since it got here. I just want to strum it constantly and I'm already thinking about getting Kala's pineapple shaped soprano.The pictures don't really do the satin finish justice either. It's almost shimmery in good lighting or sunlight and has a nice amber color to it. At this price I expected the finish to be kinda flat like cheap laminate flooring. It was a really nice surprise.Now for the "bad" (none of it's real bad) :The tuner app is easily replaced by any number of (better) free tuner apps and online lessons are everywhere thanks to a friendly and supportive community. The only real added value I see to the Learn to Play Kit as opposed to just buying the uke by itself is the gig bag and the booklet. The Kala KA-15s is, right now, just about $10 cheaper than this. I think it might've been smarter for me to just buy the ukulele and then spend around $20 to get myself a soft case. I'm not sure what I'll do with the bag after I've gotten one. It's lined and it can be worn like a backpack, but there's no storage pouches and it's very thin. It's not bad for a $10 bag I don't think, but I'm not really sure I needed it. YMMV.I wasn't happy with the way mine arrived either. Amazon had just put a shipping label on the retail box and sent it like that! What it is was fully on display for anyone to see and it also ruined the box. There were two gaping holes in the side of that box and if you've seen an unboxing you know there's only a thin foam bag and the gig bag between the uke and the cardboard box. I almost sent it right back unopened. I didn't know what I'd find in there. There's a small scratch, but it's otherwise fine and the scratch isn't very noticeable. I got in touch with Amazon today though and they gave me a partial refund immediately with absolutely zero fuss. This on a holiday! I've never had an easier customer service experience and I'd definitely buy again (judging from unboxings I've seen this isn't how Amazon usually ships them). The whole thing took maybe five minutes and my account was credited later in the day.I'm impressed.

short_d: Kala app is not included and tuner not included
content: Ok quality instrument for a beginner, but I found the description includes some false advertising. This package doesn't "include" the Kala app. You only get a free trial which lasts 4 days, then you have to buy for like $5 a month. So in reality you get a lower quality uke for $50. Not a good value in actuality. I would purchase a nice uke from an actual retailer before I would purchase this again. Don't waste your money.
name: Ryan M Miller

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2017
short_d: High quality instrument for the price of a toy
content: I received this as a Christmas gift for an upcoming trip to Oahu. This is a solid instrument with a terrific sound,and comes with Aquila Nylgut strings, which are basically industry standard. I picked it up, tuned it, and immediately belted out some Christmas carols. It does have a little trouble staying in tune, but that's pretty common for new strings. I didn't notice any slippage in the geared tuners, so I'm hoping the problem goes away as the strings stretch. The neck feels very sturdy, and the frets are beautifully set up. I didn't notice any intonation problems when depressing the strings. Overall, this is a high quality instrument for the price of a toy.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2017
content: I gave this four stars so this small review will have positives and negatives. Negatives first.I bought this Ukulele for what it is, a "learn to play" kit. I was surprised by how nice it played, and how sturdy the body, strings, and tuning pegs felt. It didn't feel cheap. Unfortunately, about 7 months after I bought it, the higher G string wouldn't tune, and then the lower G string wouldn't tune. I figured I needed to restring it. So I restring it...and it still won't tune. My friend and I took the strings off many times and strung it just to make sure we didn't have any errors. I heard that strings needed to settle for a bit. I let the Uke sit, and a few weeks went by because I got busy. I went back and tuned it, and no difference. I check the tuning pegs and they're very lose. I tried to screw them back in, but nothing worked. I guess 7 months isn't bad, but I still have my $100 electric starter guitar that I got 10 years ago when I began to play guitar, and that still works.The positives would be, as I stated above, it didn't feel cheap. The sound is beautiful, it tuned easily, and the small ukulele guide it came with really helped. Inside it tells you the standard tuning of a ukulele, gives you a free uke tuning app for your phone, and features a few songs for you to learn as well a basic chord chart.I will rebuy this again considering it lasted 7 months, but I hope this won't be an every 7-month occurrence.Note: This was my first time restringing a guitar. I used to live near a lot of guitar shops, who usually do that stuff for free, so I would take the guitars there. My friend has experience in restringing guitars though. It is likely we messed up, but I don't think tuning pegs are supposed to be this loose, even after screwing them on tighter.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2017
short_d: I was disappointed when the package arrived
content: At first, I was disappointed when the package arrived, because I thought this was a concert size (it was the first to pop up when I did a search for that on Amazon), but after opening it, it was actually a blessing in disguise because the smaller size actually suited my smaller hands/fingers better. It didn't take long to tune it up (used a combination of a snark tuner and guitartuna app). The sound is beautiful! I HIGHLY recommend the Ukulele Method Books as well. For those skeptical because of the reviews about it losing its tune, this is common for ukulele's.  It can take a week or two (depending on how much you are playing) until the strings are stretched and hold the tune.  VERY pleased with my purchase!
name: BookieBeans

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2017
short_d: This little Ukulele will brighten your day!
content: I have wanted  to play the ukulele for awhile and was overwhelmed by the choices.  As a beginner I didn't want to buy an expensive one just yet.  I also didn't want to buy one that would not generate a decent sound.  After reading up on various reviews, I determined the Kala Ukulele was a great place to start.  I absolutely love this Kala ukulele.  I was surprised by how wonderful the sound is.  A great value and I recommend this little UK for any beginners.  Its also made in the USA!!!  The short lessons that come with this kit are enough to get you started with ubderstanding simple fret progressions and a couple of strum patterns.  The only dissapointment was the flimsy bag that they try to pass off as a case.  It will not protect your uk.  I also recommend a snark tuner since the uk will get out of tune quite bit when first purchased.  I am told this is normal until you break it in.

content: I can't tell you how excited I was to get this in the mail!My worst fear with having this mailed is that it would show up broken and several pieces!Thankfully, everything was well packaged and in tact. Unfortunately, the day I got it in the mail, my brother was helping me tune it and one of the strings broke...i went on and bought a set of replacement strings right away. (we both have experience tuning stringed instruments, so i'm not sure what happened there) Because of the broken string, I haven't been able to fully practice on it yet, but the book that comes with it seems to have some solid beginner tips. date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
content: I've always wanted to play either guitar or uke or some related instrument...funny story....I'm actually a cellist and pianist. I decided to take the plunge and try this one out! Based on the reviews this little Uke didn't disappoint as others have stated. I will make one comment about the strings and tuning. Several people have said that their Uke doesn't stay in tune and others have responded that the strings take time to stretch. This is true. As a cellist I have the same issue but my instrument is a professional instrument worth thousands. The only thing I will add is that I noticed my chords are sometimes not in tune when I play but have discovered that that is not the instrument's fault but my own. The harder I press the strings down in between the frets the intonation goes sharp. I have found that if I am firm but gentle my chords stay in tune. There is a similar issue with cello even though cello is fretless. Pressure can change intonation. Just a thought for everyone out there reading these reviews! As a starter instrument, this is a nice little Uke.
name: Sarah

content: My husband purchased this kit for me as a Christmas gift. I have had it for 3 days now and I don't want to put it down! The wood grain is beautiful and the quality is superb. It doesn't feel like a toy in my hands like some of the cheaper ones I have held and It definitely doesn't look like a toy. I am having issues with is the string stretching and having to retune after a few minutes of playing, but that is to be expected with the nylon strings. I think the only thing I would like would be a more protective bag/case instead of the one that comes in the kit, there really is no protection as it is more of a dust cover/carrier.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2016
content: Amazing! Great package, beautiful little instrument, great sound. I have trouble with guitar because my fingers don't stretch to play more than three or four chords, but the size of a Uke is perfect! I taught myself to play in less than two hours. (I'm very musical, so it wasn't like I was learning from scratch. I can find my way around most instruments easily.) The tuning app worked great for me on my iPhone and iPad. It actually worked better than the clip on tuner I bought. So far I have no cons. You do need to tune it each time you play, but it takes two seconds and I've read that it's normal, especially in the beginning. I was not paid to write this review. I just love it, and only wish I had more time to play!
name: Anonymous

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2016
content: The Kala Learn to Play Ukulele Starter Kit is a great starter kit. I picked this up because I sold my six string and I felt like playing the Uke one day, but I was't sure I would be able to play it. This was cheap so I thought that I would try to learn from here first before making the commitment of buying an expensive Ukulele. The pamphlet that comes with is very helpful, however the tuning App was no help at all. I downloaded some other Android Apps that helped along the way. However, I was playing the Uke in a days time.I would highly recommend this to a beginner, somebody who wants to play but doesn't want to invest in an expensive Uke until they know they can play it. I would definitely recommend it for kids too. This is great for children.Pros:PriceCasePamphlet makes learning easyCons:Tuning App (I recommend downloading a different app)Construction feels a bit cheap (to be expected, however Kala makes really good Ukes)

name: Seattle Grandma

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2016
short_d: I'm sure it's a fine ukelele, but I think they oversold the learn ...
content: I'm sure it's a fine ukelele, but I think they oversold the learn to play part a bit. It comes with a quick start guide and then a website. The QuickStart quite is basically to tune it...except that they don't really tell you how in ANY detail. They name the strings and direct you to their app that will tell you if you're sharp or flat; however, they don't tell you where strum the string, or even if that's what I'm supposed to do. I tried several times (same string) and it said different notes each time on the app.I'm sure I sound like an idiot, but I thought that was the point. I don't know what I'm doing, so it would be nice if they explained it to me. It's like the instructions are written for someone who already plays guitar and wants to pick up ukulele or something.  I don't know how they could possibly teach me to play. I can't even get past the tuning.
name: elle1225

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2016
content: The Kala Ukulele is a good instrument to use, and it also comes in a package to keep it in good condition over the shipping. The only thing I don't really like is the tuning app for me doesn't work very well, when it was on the right tunes [ G-C-E-A ] it sounded too deep to be tuned. Other than that it's a really good uke, I highly recommend this instrument.
name: Kimberly Tudela

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
content: I would give five stars for the great ukulele but only 3 for the starter kit.The ukulele looks great, feels great and sounds great. It tuned up and remained tuned, after only 3 days.The tote bag is made of cloth with a draw string. You will definitely want to get a padded gig bag to protect this beautiful little instrument.Tuner app is availiable  to anyone on the Internet and the little pamphlet is nowhere as good as the plethora of tutors on utube.So, the extra value of the starter kit is questionable. I would highly recomnend the Kala 15s, same uke, and a gig bag with padding. You can still get the lessons and tuner app on line.Kala makes great instruments at this price point. I definitely recommend their products.
name: frs

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2016
content: Hope my 5 yr old grand daughter likes this at xmas
name: Marge Auger

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2016
short_d: Slightly misleading, but still very satisfied
content: I bought the kit because I wanted to learn how to play the ukulele and I thought that this was a great deal because it included a tuner and lessons and whatnot. Don't get me wrong, the purchase is a great deal because the uke is decently well made and has a nice sound (especially for the price!) but the tuner is just an app that's free for everyone anyway, and the online lessons are also free for everyone. I do like the little drawstring bag that the uke comes in and the start up booklet (though it would be better to have songs that more people would actually want to play lol). I spent my first day using the booklet, and I don't think I've referenced it after that. I've just used the Internet to teach myself instead. Overall, I would definitely recommend this product and brand to a friend, because a uke of this quality at this price is a pretty great deal, but just know that you'll probably need to either buy an actual instruction book or spend a lot of time watching tutorial videos on YouTube.EDIT: several months later, this is my favorite ukulele. I've bought a few more, but without a doubt this one sounds the best. I've even restrung the other ones with high quality strings, (which makes a difference) but this ukulele still sounds better with its original strings! Rating is still only 4/5 because the "starter kit" part, but if it was just the ukulele, this would definitely be a 5/5 product!

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2016
content: This ukulele has been an absolute joy to play around with ever since I bought it. I am actually a keyboard player who taught himself guitar, so I am not a stringed-instrument connoisseur, but I have had just a blast with this uke. Yes, it is somewhat toy-like, but imho all ukuleles are essentially by nature toylike. It took a week or so for the strings to start holding in tune well, which is exactly what I expected. The tuning app works like a charm, too. The booklet might be helpful to a beginner to get started. For me, I preferred to find a complete set of chords at Ukuchords.com and then just look up the tabs for any song I wanted to play. This ukulele has been one of my best purchases of the year.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016
short_d: Great little instrument that stays in tune just fine
content: I have not found an issue with constantly having to tune this uke as others have noted. It's been a lot of fun learning to play, but be aware, the toughest thing about playing the uke in my opinion is learning how to hold the little bugger. No kidding. I had no idea. You have to sort of grip it against your body with your strumming arm to leave your fretting hand free. But fear not, there are plenty of instructional videos on the Internet teaching you how to hold it. Or just throw in the towel like I have and resign yourself to only playing it sitting down with it resting on your thigh. Have fun!

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2016
content: I'm a middle aged woman that had become obsessed of late with Uklulele covers on youtube. I was super excited to get this "kit" The Ukulele is very nice. Feels and looks solid. The light Mahogony is really pretty and quite different.A musician friend of mine says its a perfect starter instrument. If I get better I will probably upgrade to a better model.They include a nice black cloth case but I mostly store mine in the cute sturdy box it arrived in.They inclclue a starter pamphlet and advice you to download their tuner app.Personally, my friend ended up giving me a snap on tuner. He showed me a few times and now I'm all set. I personally prefer that to the app. Like others have mentioned this ukulele is hard to keep in tune at first. Once the strings stretched a bit its much better.When my kit arrived the online lessons from Kala were not up yet ( they are now ) I ended up finding a gal on youtube that does tutorials. Here name is Cynthia Lin and she is great please , please check her out!I am slowly getting there but I'm really enjoying myself. Honestly I find learning the Ukulele a great stress reliever.The quality is high enough on this low priced kit to give it a try.

name: Dollface

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2016
short_d: Not a Serious Ukulele, But a Great Starter
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. Highlights of my Video Review:1.  This is not for any serious Ukulele player but it's much nicer than a toy Ukulele.  So it's somewhere in between.2.  The plastic strings it comes with will stretch out a lot, especially at first, that's just the nature of plastic strings.  It won't stay in tune for long because of this stretching out and you'll have to keep tuning it.  Once it's done stretching, it will hold the tune better.3.  The wood is gorgeous.  Look-wise is very attractive - 5-stars for looks4.  Sound quality is good5.  The cardboard box it came in acts as a little case and the supplied, lined bag is a nice touch.  I put it in the bag and back in the box for storage6.  There is nothing to attach a Ukulele Strap to.7.  Comes with a free tuning app which works well and you can go online for more tutorials and help.  Don't forget YouTube...there are useful vids there that can help teach you.8.  In conclusion - this is a great starter kit.  If you are serious musician - you'll probably be disappointed by the plastic strings and the lack of place to attach a strap.  I think it's doable, but for the price, you could get a more serious instrument in the first place.  If you're getting this for a child - they will be absolutely ecstatic - this is a beautiful piece that does not look like a toy and has a great sound - be aware that the wood is thin and will not take a lot of abuse.If there are any questions, please feel free to leave me comments below and I will do my best to answer them.  Thank you!

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2016
short_d: It sounds horrible, would not stay in tune for even a ...
content: If I could give this zero stars, I would.  It sounds horrible, would not stay in tune for even a second, and is cheap in tone, look, etc.  I hate it and believe I wasted my money.  It is going in the garbage.
name: All One

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2016
content: Great beginner uke.  You definitely have to tune it a few times the first week but then it stays in tune longer the more you use it.  I'm already playing songs after the first week.  The kids have started teaching themselves as well.  It looks nice and not like a toy.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2016
content: Lovely little starter Ukulele kit - comes with all of the accessories you'll need, along with a little carrying bag that is just perfect to store the instrument in.  This isn't a very heavy or substantial-feeling instrument (really high quality ukuleles have some "heft" despite their small size), because I assume it's made with lighter woods.  But it has a nice sound and plays a jaunty tune well.  This is a lot easier to pull out than a full sized guitar to play to my toddler.  I haven't experienced the trouble others have with it keeping tune, but I manually tuned without the app.  Perfect little fun instrument to keep around!
