date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
content: The sound is so beautiful and chords are easy to play. Instrument came totally set up and required only minor tuning, which is good. Seller had wonderful communication and instrument arrived promptly and in perfect condition.  I love how it sounds, how it's made and what it comes with!  I love this ukulele. Absolutely wonderful for the money!
name: Ekaterina

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2016
short_d: A great starter kit with online help & app
content: Firstly, at this time the set is currently unavailable here on Amazon... And my daughters and I are currently working through the KALA online content provided (including a free tuning app) I will add more updates here as we work with the set more. But it is an excellent starter set for the cost, sturdy with a nice sound. It comes with a nylon drawstring  bag for travel & storage. The physical starter book that comes with set  covers tuning, how to hold and strum, as well as making chords. The booklet is a bit brief, but as I mentioned there is more extensive online content provide by KALA. On-line content includes video on tuning and how to play "This Land is Your Land," "Pachelbel's canon in C," & "House of the Rising Sun."

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2016
content: This is a very tiny ukulele. I mean, a uke is a small instrument, but this one is about 2/3 the size of our first ukulele. The tote bag/case is very lightweight -- comparable to those freebies you get at carnivals and fairs. The tuner is actually an app you download, not a digital device itself. The guide is a small pamphlet. So, yes, it's a kit, but calling it a "starter kit" is very apt. It's just the basics for someone wanting to get started with the instrument. The kids couldn't keep their hands off of it! They tuned it easily using the app. And it's very fun to fiddle around with. So for what it is, five stars!
name: Jimmie Quick

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2016
content: I can't play Freebird. I can't play anything Segovia ever did. Clapton? Hendrix? Harrison? Page? Nothing, nothing, nothing. Any of them, though guitarists, could play the ukulele better than I can.I can learn the uke at a basic enough level, I think, to pick out a few songs and impress guests in my home (so long as I do not also sing).To say the "Kala Learn To Play Ukulele Starter Kit" is entry level is an understatement. But it is a fun toy that can, in fact, make music and introduce people to an instrument inexpensively. If the uke player in your family shows they've got skill, upgrade. Until then, this is a fine place to start.The tuning app (download from Apple or Android sites) work well. I tuned using this easily. Play a string and tune until the meter indicates the note you intend.--Brockeim

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
content: I don't know how to play the Ukulele, but I wish to learn.  I always enjoyed the sound.  With that said, this is an affordable starter kit for the Ukulele student.  It is light weight, and beautiful looking with the mahogany finish.  There is an instruction manual to teach you basic cords, and an app for your phone to tune the instrument.  Does it feel cheap?  I have no idea.  I never touched an expensive Ukulele before.  This is my first time holding one.  It feels so tiny in my arms, but fun to hold and listen to.  It feels fine, and sounds nice to me.  It comes in an attractive cardboard box, and includes a bag for it.  I play Piano and do know there is a difference in quality in instruments given the price point, so I am sure an experienced Ukulele player will say this is cheap, henceforth they call it the "starter kit".  It is good if you feel you want to learn, or someone who might and you won't feel bad if you quit because it didn't cost an arm and leg.  Don't expect a thousand dollar instrument when you aren't paying for a thousand dollar instrument and you should be Hopefully I can actually pick it up so I can play "somewhere over the rainbow" on the beach one day.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
content: Keep in mind that this is meant for students according to the marketing. Not accomplished aficionados of the ukulele. This will affect just how one views the product and my review.It's on the cheap side, I'm afraid. You are getting what you pay for... and if you're paying for something to work with while learning to play, this is just fine, meaning it will respectably do the job. And it doesn't ask to so much more. It's a cute little starter kit with online lesson options if you're a self-learner. I like the little bag it comes with.However, it's just not that great of an instrument if quality is what you're looking for. My sister who owns and plays a higher quality instrument had much to say in regards... suffice it to say these things can be made better. It's smallish, tendency to fall out of tune quickly.Though that does mean you have an inexpensive option you can graduate from later, so view it as you will.
name: Emily J. Morris

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
content: I've never picked up a ukulele before, but took guitar lessons for a while when I was a kid.  Since getting this Kala Ukulele Starter Kit, I've been having quite a bit of fun with it.First, the ukulele is very pretty.  It's small and kind of adorable.  It comes with a carrying case and a "quick start" booklet.  Out of the box, the ukulele was way out of tune.  I downloaded the Kala app for tuning the instrument, which works well.  I did have to look up a video to hear what the strings sound like when in tune, which was a big help the first time I tuned the ukulele.The Kala website is supposed to include free video lessons, but those are not yet available.  If you subscribe to Kala's weekly lessons, you will get a discount code to a free month of lessons from a different site.  Kala's videos are supposed to be online and ready by the time the free trial ends.  However, you have to sign up to this other site and give them your credit card info.  I think I will wait for Kala's free lessons.With the quick start book, I was actually able to play a song on the ukulele within hours of its arrival.  It is a lot of fun to play and sounds very sweet.  I'm looking forward to learning more songs.  I am unfortunately not a singer by any stretch of the imagination, but my daughter is.  I hope to learn some sings that she can sing along with and maybe inspire her to also learn the ukulele.The only thing I've noticed about this instrument that is a bit of a drawback is that it does not stay in tune very long at all.  After several minutes of playing, a couple of the strings become noticeably out of tune, which really affects the sound of the instrument.  For learning and having fun, this is OK, but if you want something you can eventually play on for other people, you may want to invest in a higher end model.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
content: I've been a guitarist for over twenty years and was always hesitant to pick up the ukelele, but with all the social isolation happening, I thought I'd give it a try. I found this particular instrument to be at the right price range. I couldn't see myself spending hundreds on an instrument that I may or may not actually use. I also didn't want to buy some cheap piece of junk either. It shipped quickly and looks better in person than in the photos! It also comes with a strap, extra strings, a polish rag, a tuner, picks, and a case! The most impressive part of all the extras, to me, was the handy chord chart that came in the package. So, so happy to have this and ready to learn some UKE!

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
content: Cheap enough to see if you're interested and doesn't sound bad.
name: Nate

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020

name: Straight Talk

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
content: I have the Concert size of the Donner basic beginner uke.. the DUC 1, which I cannot even find on here....but it has been SO AMAZING, I want to share my experience with this brand of Ukulele, as I assume that the DUS 1 was surely made around the same time (since I see that there are now DUC 2 and DUC 3 available...so the DUS 1 is surely in the same generation as the previous DUC 1---ANYWAY).My Donner Uke was a Christmas present, and my hubby knocked it out of the park! We both were doing research on affordable but decent quality ukes, and when I heard how much he knew one day, I decided to let the topic go, as I suspected I had a sweet surprise gift coming...and I was right!The thing is, this uke has SPOILED ME. I have since purchased another uke from another brand, expecting the same or even better components based on that brand's reputation, and while it is great, I can tell you that the Donner Uke came out above and set a high bar!I will share a list of what I like in just a moment, but I also want to say how fun and gratifying it is to have since seen popular vloggers doing reviews of the Donner Uke and being delightfully surprised by what a great uke and what a great value it is!So...what I love, and what set a high bar for all other ukes to follow in my life:-low action. Before I even knew what that meant, I experienced it. In trying out ukes at stores since, I am shocked at how many have higher action. This uke is very playable. (again, speaking of the DUC-1, but surely same generation as DUS 1.-Tone---this has a lovely, warm, rich, mellow tone. I am certainly one who prefers that kind of tone, one that is almost guitar-like, over the brighter type uke sounds.-Tune-ability--- this uke was holding tune from the get-go! Once I tuned it the first time, I only had to adjust it a tiny bit each day if I were really picky...which I thought might be normal. I kept hearing about how new ukes often have to settle in for a month, but that was not my experience...and this did not come from a store showroom, but was mail order...so, it's possible that it was on a store floor before it was mailed, but since it had previously been an amazon-only product (from what I hear), I doubt it. And this was one of the ways this uke spoiled me, because in my 2nd uke, I found I was having to tune it within 10 minutes of playing! It took about a month to settle in with that one...-Accessories--The tuner is great. Multi-functional, even. I have not needed to use the strings or picks (which the picks are the usual "why did we get this?" situation found in many beginner kits, since they are really more for guitar)....but the Gig-Bag is awesome! Really great quality for a beginner uke kit! And this was another of the "this uke spoiled me" items...because in my 2nd uke purchase mentioned above, from the more well-known company, the gig bag that came with that 2nd uke was shockingly thin, like a windbreaker. Parachute material type. The gig bag that comes with the Donner Kit is very sturdy material and nice padding.  Maybe it is not premium and maybe it is not a hard case, but it does feel like good protection...AND, the pocket on the outside is a good size and actually usable. I have seen reviews of other gig bags where the pocket is so tightly connected to the bag that it is unusable. This one has a good inch or two of space within... Not to mention there are TWO straps, and a carry handle.So...hands down, my Donner uke is my favorite. I am sure there will be more ukes to come in my life (I want them all), but this one set the bar high....but at such a low price.  What a value!

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
short_d: very very good uke for the money!
content: ok how about i rate the things that matter the most:intonation: 4/5the intonation is perfectly fine if you are playing regular chords. if you go beyond the 7th fret you start to notice a little bit of dissonance and beyond 12th fret it doesnt sound very good.tuning/strings: 5/5as good at staying in tune as my classical guitars. i see a lot of reviews for nylon stringed instruments complaining that they won't stay in tune. this is usually misleading. it can take a few days for nylon strings to stretch out enough to hold tuning, and this is in addition to a little bit of manual stretching and persistent playing and tuning. i waited a few days to write a review precisely because of this. this ukelele holds tune very well. the tuners seem to be good quality (but im no expert on that) and the bridge and nut are good quality and dont snag the strings too much. 4 days into playing i can set the uke down for a few hours and come back and it's still in tune (well, good enough to fiddle around on anyway)action: 5/5just about perfect. it remains to be seen if the neck or body warp and ruin the action, but that's how it goes with things made of wood.sound: 5/5im not an expert by any means, but it sounds really good to my ears. it's mellow, woody, subtle, deep. but it also projects really well for such a small instrument. the strings that come on the uke are aquila super nylgut (at least on the one i got, maybe results vary?) i havent tried too many different brands of nylon strings but aquila are the best i've used.overall quality: 5/5no rough edges. parts seem well made. nothing loose. it's very pretty looking. the finish is so light that you can feel the texture of the wood.also it comes with a clip on tuner that works well, an extra set of strings (donner brand/no name?), a few picks, a strap, and a case.  the case is really good. it's a soft case but with a lot of cushioning. zippers and stitching seem decent quality. the strap is not good. the ends are shaped completely wrong and the peg is on the neck way too close to the frets so it gets in the way of your fretting hand. it's easy enough to fix if you want to use a strap but probably involves moving the neck strap peg and cutting one end of the strap.i bought this uke cause i wanted something decent to play that was small enough to strap to the back of my bicycle. it was cheap enough to take a chance on and well worth taking a chance on. it is perfect for my needs and holds up to my personal standards. i highly recommend it for anyone that wants a decent quality instrument but doesn't want to (or can't) spend a lot of money.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
short_d: Great uku...until it wasn't and not fixed by Donner
content: I've been a fan of Donner and their musical instruments for years.  I've got a Donner concert acoustic/electric tenor Uku and have been very happy overall.  I bought this soprano for my niece expecting the same level of craftsmanship, but unfortunately, the uku failed under normal use.  I reached out to customer care and was told they wouldn't cover it even though this is clearly a failure of manufacturing (glue didn't hold) and not due to mishandling.  Before that, we were very happy with it.  I'm surprised as Donner usually has great customer service.
name: Eren

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
short_d: Great price and easy to learn
content: Bought this for my daughter for christmas she loves it and for the price
name: Sandra Kososki

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
content: I honestly wasn't expecting to get something so decent for the price, especially given all the other items in the order (quality gig bag, extra strings, tuner, etc). But I wanted to learn the uke and didn't want to spend a fortune. Skimming other reviews on ukes around Amazon, I saw the Donner brand was recommended, so I thought I'd give the concert size a chance.Tuning for the first time was a nightmare, but that's true of any brand new strings, and they still don't hold their tune for more than a few minutes. That will improve with time, so I'm not deducting any stars or points for that -- it's just fair warning for anyone not used to new nylon strings who may be wondering what is going on with their instrument.  The sound is good - the concert size is less "plinky" than the soprano ukes, so the tone is a little softer, which I prefer.The uke is very lightweight, but the frets are smooth and the action is low enough that it's easy to manage fingering without having to struggle to push the strings down or get that godawful buzz when playing. I honestly was expecting I'd have to take a nail file to the sides, given how many other bargain ukes have rough finishes, and was very pleased not to run into that here.  I also found that while it still has a faint chemical smell from the varnishing/building process, it has faded quickly overnight.TL;DR - this is a great bundle if you want to learn the Uke.  You get everything you need to start (the hang tag even has common chords and how to finger them). Bonus, when I purchased, there was a coupon for a few more bucks off, making it a better bargain than other similar bundles available.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
content: After re-stringing and fine-tuning the saddle and nut, I finally took this to a luthier for help in resolving an annoying buzzing on the G string. The verdict was that the neck was twisted and bowed, but by that time I had destroyed the shipping materials so did not feel right about returning the instrument. So, the warning to buyers is: Check the neck for bowing and/or twisting--if there are signs, return the instrument immediately rather than trying to resolve the problem yourself. This is an inexpensive instrument, so don't expect it to sound and perform like a $200 or more instrument. This is a BEGINNERS' instrument...learn to play on it, then buy a better one when you know what you want.

He was so happy when he received this gift it is exactly what I was expecting to receive and he is looking forward to learning this instrument.The entire product is excellent craftsmanship. I would definitely recommend this to a friend or anyone wanting to  Learn to play the ukulele. It was a reasonable price for all of the items included in the order at no additional cost. content: This was the second ukulele I bought to get my son started in learning music. I was thrilled at first. It stayed in tune, it sounded beautiful and was easy to handle. However, a few months in, it doesn't stay in tune. And I don't mean after a few days... I mean I play one chord on it and the next one is out of tune. I'm very disappointed for the price paid.
name: Mel

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
content: Everything was very nice and better than expected.
name: Karen

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
content: Trash quality, trash everything. It comes with a gutair pic??? Which was the first warning sign it was gonna be bad. The tunner was out of tune which was quite ironic. After a minute or two it turned off and stoped working completely. Also the tuners directions are all in a foreign language. Not convenient. Moving on to the strap, it was okay not the best. The wood of the uke itself is trash, it scrapes, I don’t even think it’s real wood, but a plastic? The ukes sound quality is average and NOT GOOD. I suggest this for a one time thing, or for a brand new player who’s semi interested. But please go elsewhere. Luna has great ukes! About the same price without the add ons. Which all get thrown away anyway so mind as well buy a good quality uke by itself.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
content: I got this as an Xmas gift for a music lover. I took it out to "test the quality": tuned it up and jammed for a few hours because I've never played a Ukulele. Very easy to learn the chords. I went online and found a few recommended chord progressions and got strumming. Sounds beautiful for such as cheap instrument, never thought about it before but I guess there isn't much difference between this and a cigar-box guitar (minus the pickups and different string material). Great for anyone looking to start learning music or a music fan that wants a toy they can travel with. I will probably order another one of these for myself.I still can't believe it came with so many accessories: picks, soft travel case, extra strings, strap, and a vibration-style tuner! The box that arrived was so light I was ready to curse myself if I accidentally bought $70 of ukulele accessories with no ukulele. I used a guitar tuner I trust so I can't speak to one that comes with it but they're a cheap item no matter what. The wood of the instrument is very very light and soft, to the point I'm afraid of scratching it, so I'd recommend moving to a hard case when you can.Might be worth noting: the shipping box was much larger than the package box, about 4 ft long or so, so if you live in an apartment don't be surprised if they had to leave it with the front desk.

name: Garrett Prosper

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
content: I purchased this uke solely based on reviews, as I had no experience and couldn’t play yet. I wasn’t disappointed! I have had it a month now, and I play it an average of 2 hours per day. After the first 3 days of string stretching and tuning, I rarely have to tune it. Maybe a slight tweak every few days but that’s about it (I’m not gentle with it, so that says something!).The strings it came set up with are decent and good quality. The action is perfect. It has 2 strap buttons already attached to it (one on the body and one at the base of the neck) which is a nice perk. The craftsmanship is beautiful and time was taken with assembly. It has a nice, hollow, rich sound. The accessories it comes with seal the deal! The gig bag is sturdy, padded, and great quality. The digital tuner works fine (although I use a tuning app most of the time). The strap is functional and good quality. It comes with extra strings that are clear but when the time comes I’ll probably put nylgut on instead. It comes with 4 standard guitar picks that are pretty useless for a ukulele but come in handy if you play guitar!Overall, this is a fantastic beginner ukulele that comes with everything you need to get playing right away. Donner has a winner! Watch out Kala!!

One thing though, (and this has nothing to do with the product itself, just playing a string instrument for the first time) playing the ukulele hurts! My fingers haven’t formed calluses yet so playing and strumming hurts and I didn’t realize that that was a thing until I started playing. date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
short_d: If you are going to carry your uke in a gig bag this is a very playable uke for only $65
content: I bought this to stand in for my 20TM that apparently got stepped on. A word to wise, if you have a uke that you like lose the gig bag and buy yourself a hard case. So I bought this because it had good reviews, was only $65 and my other uke got stepped on. It came in a big box with the uke in its own box wrapped in foam. I unpacked and looked it over. I found one small dark spot on the side where it joins the top and towards the back found another small chip on the top where it joins the side. I deduct one star on craftsmanship but really they are just cosmetic and otherwise appearance is quite nice so decide to continue as was only $65. I breakout the tuner which works fine after I continue pushing the on button until a G appears. The strings are stretchy as all new strings but begin to dial in. The E string knob slips a bit so I grab a small screwdriver and tighten the loose screw then snug up the other three  because I have the screwdriver in my hand.  I deduct one more star for loose screw. GCEA all dial in. I play You Are My Sunshine.  I put the uke , extra strings, picks(I don't use) and tuner in the gig bag which is actually quite nice also. I have been playing this daily and strings are pretty well settled in. I give one star back because this a very playable uke with great tone even comparable to a uke which cost several times as much and did I mention it's only $65.  It's only been a week but I would buy this uke again and recommend as a great starter uke or spare for more advanced player.

name: z28junkie

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2019
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. Let me start this review by saying I know NOTHING about playing an instrument besides the tambourine. Back in my teens a friend taught me how to play 2 very basic songs in the guitar and then I gave up. The guitar seemed complicated and big and inconvenient. Fast forward 20 years later, I am a 37 year old mother of 2 and had a realization, what’s stopping me from learning how to play an instrument AND teach my homeschooled children? I figured the ukulele would be closest to a guitar in a simpler way, I love the fact that it’s small and you only have to deal with 4 strings and not 6! Now, make no mistake, I did not purchase this ukulele completely blinded. My husband is a seasoned musician, he has been playing drums, guitar and a little bit of piano since he was 8; our garage is full of guitars and amps and what not, so I asked for his guidance in choosing a decent ukulele and after days or research the Donner seemed to be the best we found for the price. He suggested I get the concert and not the soprano, and that was a good choice as the soprano might have been a little too small. I gotta say I am super impressed with the craftsmanship and the quality of it, the body is a beautiful mahogany, even to the inexperienced eye it looks like a high end instrument. This is not a toy like I may have thought in the back of my head! Upon arrival, all I knew about ukuleles was pretty much how to hold it (duh! Who doesn’t right?) but my husband wasn’t home to help me tune it so I was left to my own devices. Thank heavens for YouTube! The tuner included is SUPER helpful and EASY to use! When I say easy I’m talking, EASY! Even when you’ve never touched a tuner in your life! *raises hand*. (Btw pay no attention to the negative reviews saying it doesn’t stay in tune, my husband explained to me that this is normal for ANY new string instrument and the strings need to be stretched and get used to being played so it may take a few days). So, as soon as my ukulele was tuned properly I resorted back to YouTube to learn 2 basics: chords and strumming. Within a couple hours I was playing this song (video), I mean, why wouldn’t I start with “Somewhere over the rainbow”?. Not perfect but this was day ONE, the same day I unboxed an instrument I had NEVER player before, ever. My husband came home and was super impressed with not just the ukulele and its sound, but also the extras! The case and the strap are actually really nice and his musician self approves of the tuner as well. The ukulele is also easy for my 7 year old daughter to handle, and she’s practicing her strumming as I type this. Overall, this has already been one of the best purchases I’ve ever made, and I’m determined to keep practicing and mastering my favorite songs!Day 2 - I’m able to play a song with a few simple chords AND SING! at the same time!!! All in all I highly recommend the Donner Concert Ukulele (DUC-1) to anyone who really wants to learn! A great first instrument for beginners, young and old!UPDATE: 7 months playing DAILY I’m officially a campfire player. The uke turned into a serious hobby, one that I eagerly practice every single day and even bring with me when I go out of town and even to the park on a beautiful day. I now know quite a few songs by memory, I’m completely comfortable playing my Donner uke, and it’s quality and sound have lived up to my standards. I can also fingerpick a few songs which I never thought I’d be able to do! Love my Donner uke!
name: Mrs.Gal

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
content: Beginner here! Very happy with the quality of this little Donner ukelele. Comes with everything you might need to get going (though I have been advised against using the picks), and for an impatient person like me, the tuner was intuitive to use without delving into microscopic instructions. Snapped a string right off the bat from tuning it too tightly and was able to quickly replace it with the strings provided. The body has a beautifully rich color and produces an equally rich sound - I'm a little worried about annoying my downstairs neighbor!Tuning issues: Many reviewers are complaining that this instrument has issues staying in tune, and mostly, they're right. The C string holds its pitch well, but the others need continual tuning. This turned out to be less annoying than I anticipated, however. From my understanding, this is typical of newly stringed ukeleles, and the tuning issues should lessen as the strings begin to stretch.Overall great value, in my non-expert opinion, and highly recommended!
name: Carolyn M Goebel

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018
short_d: Lovely but upper register difficult for me
content: 0:000:00This video is not intended for all audiences. What date were you born? Flash Player is required to watch this video.Install Flash PlayerSorry, this video is unsupported on this browser. The Donner soprano ukulele feels well crafted and sounds mellow with a nice sustain open and in the lower to mid registers but I found the upper registers very difficult to get a clear undampened sound.I compared it to the Kmise soprano and Ranch Concert. I decided to keep those two and return the Donner.I’ll post photos and videos for you to compare. I’m not a Ukulele  player. I used to play guitar. Maybe your strong nimble fingers will get that clear ringing sound in the upper registers that I just couldn’t get.  I’m buying these as gifts.
name: Shopper#9

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
content: This is my first experience with a ukulele, but so far I'm impressed!  It looks good, sounds good, and the tuner works for my guitar too.  I would definitely reccommend this to anyone looking for a very nice / affordable instrument.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
content: This ukulele, is really great. It plays well and it came with a easy to use clip-on tuner, extra strings, a few guitar picks, a gig bag, and a strap. If you're looking for a higher pitched ukulele, I would recommend getting the soprano, not the concert or tenor. Overall I'm in love with my ukulele and it arrived almost five days early.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
content: This is a good quality Ukulele and the accessories are very useful!
name: James

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
content: I play piano, guitar, mandolin and a little banjo, but I'm no ukulele pro. On a trip to a local "big box" music Center, I picked up a ukulele and immediately had to have one. I like the tenor ukulele best, but I picked up this concert size uke to play with on a Black Friday sale. The instrument itself has a clear, crisp sound. It actually holds tune very well after you get the nylon strings stretched. It shipped with the strings very loosely strung. The real surprise was the tuner, I thought I would throw it away, but it's actually a good tuner. I use Snark tuners on all my other string instruments and I clipped one of them on the uke with the included "Donner" branded tuner and they both matched up. Overall quality product, I am very satisfied as a beginner ukulele player.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
short_d: Beautiful sound. Metal frets weren't cut cleanly though.
content: This is a beautiful uke. The sound is so warm. Really love it. My only problem, is that the metal frets were a little sharp on the edges. When you looked closely, they weren't cut cleanly, leaving sharp metal points on most of them. I've been able to pick them away, even sanded a few down. It is ok now. Still sometimes catches on my fingers slightly. I assume it will wear down with time, but still felt a little sloppy of craftsmanship. But I would still recommend based on the everything else and the quality of the sound.

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because the nut (the white part right after the head) is a bit chipped/broken where the G string is, but it's not very noticeable. I didn't notice till almost 2 months after owning it. Overall, really recommend buying this ukulele!

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2018
short_d: Love my Ukulele with the case to store it in!
content: My father played the fiddle, my Brother played 2 or more musical instruments and I knew 3 or 4 chords on the piano(I didn't want to over do it) and sometimes we would have our own little (Jam Sessions).  Somewhere  along the line we accumulated a Ukulele.  Never did try it out very much.  Time went by-Got married and had a family and I always wondered about that musical instrument called a Ukulele.  My family all are married now and  my husband passed away last year.  I am now 83 years of age and thought about that little instrument called a Ukulele.  I am so happy I ordered one.  When it arrived I was like a little kid getting his favorite thing for Christmas.  I only know 2 or 3 chords but hopefully as time goes by I will learn more.  It looks good and is very well made.  I am so happy with it.

name: K413B

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
content: This soprano appears to be modeled after the traditional ukes of the early 20th Century.  The width of the neck is wider than any of my other ukes, including my name brand tenor.  That being said, any baritone or guitar player may find this a more comfortable fit than other ukes.  The banding on the neck includes inlay marking, not the paint found on others. The construction  methods used are of surprising quality for the price point of this kit.  The serpentine lining strips, used to fasten the top and bottom along the inside edge, are superior to flat ones usually found in inexpensive instruments, giving this soprano structural stability.  Minor finish imperfections are to be expected.  The tone is clean and loud, no buzzing or other unexpected sounds. The use of Aquila strings would be an improvement in overall sound and performance.The case is a well fitting durable cloth case with a sizable pocket that easily fits all the accessories included with the kit.  All accessories are working as expected, after several months of use.  Good kit to travel or camp with at good price.
name: Randy Blair

name: Juan Lucero

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2018
content: I purchased a Hola, a Kala, and a Donner in the same week and had high hopes for the Kala,since it was the most expensive Uke, however, the Donner actually arrived with nearly perfect chromatic tuning,and that is what I play most since the Kala still does not not play in tune as well as the Donner.The Kala has an absolutely beautiful finish but chromatically way out of tune to the point I could not play it.Turns out the nut was just glued in the wrong place even though the fretboard was sized correctly - just sloppy workmanship.1/16" gap between the nut and fretboard on one side and 1/32" on the other! There is not supposed to be any gap!So I ripped off the nut and put it where it belongs and now it is much better, but the first fret still needs to be filed down a little more.Unfortunately I can't recommend anyone else trying this.I give the Kala two stars because this was NOT a $50 ukulele, and should not be so bad out of tune.The Hola was almost as bad, but only $50 so no big surprise there.Had I kept the packaging, I would have sent the Kala back. however, I wanted to see if I could fix it.The Donner arrived with nearly perfect chromatic tuning right out of the box, and has a nice wide fretboard and meaty neck.The Donner strings also hold their tune much better than the Kala or Hola, I am guessing due to the wider neck.UPDATE: NOW I'm MAD - I purchased 5 Ukeleles from Amazon recently, a HILO,  KALA,  HOLA, ENYA, and a DONNER.The DONNER, being one of the cheapest is the only one with good intonation (is chromatically in tune all the way up to the 12th fret).ALL the others are so bad, they are virtually unplayable to a musicians ear without modifcations.IF DONNER can do it, WHY can't the others, especially when they are more expensive ?The craftsmanship on most of these UKES are excellent considering the cost, but the most important thing in my mind, is that a musical instrument should at least be in tune. The HILO was so bad, also in other areas that I returned it.Most people will not be able to correct these UKES without taking to a instrument professional for repair.This is just WRONG!I recently purchased the Concert Version, however, Amazon prevents me from writing a review on the Concert so I will modify this review.The Concert version arrived with bad fret buzz so I returned it.On the positive side- it did have nice intonation like the Tenor version. unfortunately the fret buzz made it unplayable.

content: I bought this 3 months ago and I’ve absolutely loved it since day 1. This is my first ukelele and as a beginner I’ve had a great experience learning this instrument. It is well made and has a nice sound to it. The strings don’t need much tuning after you play with them for a little. You get a nice carrying case with an extra front pocket, picks, strap, extra strings and a digital tuner that works with ukelele guitar bass and violin. It’s been a great first instrument for me to learn and has opened me up to the world of playing and composing, a great peaceful, enjoyable and creative outlet! I originally wanted a guitar but settled for a ukelele to save money at the time and I’m glad I did! Great size to easily take wherever you want to go, I even ride my longboard and play sometimes. This is the only ukelele I’ve owned so I haven’t compared it to others but I would definitely reccommed this product. I have also recently purchased a guitar from the same company Donner which is great quality as well.P.S. content: This is a great Uke!  I was a total rookie and this uke helped me learn how to play.  I have improved so I thought it was time to upgrade to a quality instrument and spend some money.  I passed on my Donner Tenor Uke to a friend and purchased my new high end uke.  I was really surprised to find very little difference in playability and sound between the two.  I realized the Donner was actually a really nice Uke after getting to know my new one.  You get some great accessories with the Donner kit and it's such good quality for the price.  The only thing I would suggest is to upgrade the strings AFTER the included strings wear out.  They give you a second set of Donner strings which are great to keep tucked away in your case for an emergency.  The strings that come with it aren't bad, but high end strings only cost around $8.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2018
short_d: Nice, attractive, basic Uke with accessories.
content: My son really likes this Uke.  I bought it on a bit of a whim, after he had tried his cousin's and enjoyed it.  We didn't want the toy quality commonly available, nor do we need a professional version.  When it first arrived, I thought that maybe I made a mistake, as this is a Soprano.  As you might expect, that means it is on the smaller side.  I was worried that his hands would be too large.  Perhaps for someone who is just starting with string instruments, it might be.  He already plays the violin, harp and guitar, and he was able to pick this right up and play it.  We have now had it for eight months, and it has held up just fine.  It holds the tuning well.It is wearing on the bridge much faster than his other instruments.  Since those are high-end, and this is one that was purchased for fun, I wouldn't expect it to be the same, and you'd best not expect that, either.  The bag exceeded my expectations.  It is very sturdy, and the pocket on it has a lot of room!  If he strolls the beach with this, he could carry the extra strings, a tuner, his wallet and car keys in there, too.  The zipper is smooth and great quality.  This shipped in a sturdy box, that worked to keep it well protected.  We were going to mail this at one point, as he's moved half-way across the country.  That plan was a mistake, as the length of this makes it quite pricey for private shipping.  It will fit into a suitcase, though, so it is coming along when we go to visit and see his new place.I hope that this review is helpful to you; do let me know, and happy shopping!

Also it doesn't get out of tune as much as the other one and I play on this one more.  My daughter wants this one now.  At first my finger pads were a little sore bc this was my first time playing, but I noticed that the strings in this are not as hard as the other one.  Also what we like is tga spacing on this uku is wider so it's great for beginners who have to stretch their fingers to play certain chords.  For me the E chord is impossible.  I would definitely recommend this.

No its not a Kamaka, or Martin etc. , but  Ive already played it for some people and they commented on it sounding good.  Best 63.00 bucks Ive spent in a long time . The strings are a no name brand, but it still sound good.  Ill eventually switch them , but it plays and sound fine  as is.  Im not a beginner Ive been playing guitar mando uke etc. for 35 yrs.  This is worth buying.

content: I ordered this ukulele for my daughter, who had borrowed a friend's ukulele so she could learn to play. She decided she wanted her own, and her friend recommended that she get a concert ukulele rather than the cheaper one she had been using. My daughter couldn't be happier with this ukulele! It is beautifully made, and comes with a cushioned case, strap, tuner, extra strings, and picks. As her friend suggested, the sound is much better than on the cheaply-made ukulele. I would have been tempted to order the cheaper one if I were unsure that my daughter was committed to learning to play. After all, a quality instrument is only a better value if it actually gets used. But I am glad we made the investment in a good ukulele, and it wasn't all that much more expensive, especially considering all the accessories that came with it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2018
short_d: Great Craftsmanship but I think there's a problem with my C and E strings
content: I got it because I wanted to learn how to play and after a lot of investigating on who to buy it from I chose this bc out of all the brands I looked into this one was the one that was selling for a good price and have an enormous pile of good reviews. I watched some of the videos that people had and it sounded great. I bought it during my winter break and so I got to play it a couple of time and the sound wasn't like the videos. The one I have has a little defect I think or maybe it's just be but it only happens of the second and third stings - when I strum there's this buzz sound vibration that isn't the note. It's from the neck of the uke and I am not a big fan of it. It doesn't happen when I play it on the first string. I have only had this time (spring break) to actually sit and play and so I am now writing this review. I would totally recommend this and dont get me wrong, the uke is amazing and the craftsmanship is superb but the little sound defects on the C and E string just gets me and it's unpleasant to play on.

content: This was made of plastic which definitely threw off the sound. The strings were not very good and would not tune. The tuner that came with this it also off. Pretty much the only good things about this were the picks and the strap. Not worth the money at all. I would rather just find a quality one and pay a little more. Will be returning.
name: Rachel Godsmark

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
short_d: Nice beginner set for the price!
content: My 12yo daughter chose this set after playing my Cordoba ukulele and she's very happy with her choice! While the Donner is definitely a budget uke, it looks and sounds very nice and comes with great accessories. The gig bag is great quality with a large pouch to store accessories, and the installed strap buttons and strap, tuner, and extra strings make this a great value for the $53 price. It has everything you need for a beginner, other than maybe a capo. I think the set would make a nice gift for a beginner wanting to learn the ukulele. The differences I see between this uke and a more expensive one are that this Donner is a little wider and heavier in the headstock, and maybe doesn't have quite the sound quality of a better uke, but it's still very enjoyable to play and my daughter loves it. I think you could upgrade the strings for an even better sound. Be patient because new strings take a while to stretch and the uke will not stay in tune until the strings are tight. The strings on this uke were very loose on arrival and took lots of tuning, but after a couple weeks of use it stays in tune very nicely.

I figured I would try it out because it had great reviews and came with a bunch of stuff like the case, the strap, the tuner, and extra strings. I am SO happy I bought this because it has exceeded my expectations. It sounds great, looks great, and the price was great. date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2018
short_d: Awesome Ukulele with Many Extras at an Unbelievable Price
content: This is a fantastic concert ukulele at a great price.  I'm a brand-new ukulele player but when my son was recently at my house (he is a very experienced guitar, mandolin and uke player), he picked up this ukulele and started playing it and it sounded fantastic.  The sounds he was able to get out of it were incredible.  When I took it to a recent class, one of my fellow students leaned over and said, "Wow, I wish I had gotten a strap for my ukulele."  I proudly told her, "Hey, I not only got the strap but also a nice case, a tuner, strings, and a pick ...all included in the Amazon package deal."  I knew enough to expect it to not stay in tune for a few days after I received it.  The brand-new strings needed time to adjust.  Within a few days though, it was holding its tuning from day to day with very little need for adjustment.  I'm very glad that I made the decision to purchase this as my first ukulele.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
short_d: A 4 But Probably Deserves a 5 at This Price Point.
content: A 4 because after all it is a Chinese massed produced beginner uke.  Its just not going to sound like an expensive uke.  That being said it works good.  Stays in tune.  No buzzes. Comes with everything you need.  Soft case, tuner, straps and picks.  The picks will probably go unused. I think that it meets all the requirements of a beginner.  There are other ukes at this $65 price point.  It would be interesting to know how other $65 ukes compare.Update:  I've had this uke for a year and it gets a good amount of use.  Nothing has broken on it and it stays in tune.  The intonation might be off a small amount and the action could be better but at this price point I have no real complaints.  It exceeds my expectations.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2018
short_d: ... expensive tenor ukulele from a different brand that I love, but I wanted an inexpensive soprano that I ...
content: I have a much more expensive tenor ukulele from a different brand that I love, but I wanted an inexpensive soprano that I could travel with, since it's smaller and I don't have to worry about it the cost if it's damaged, lost, or stolen.The sound you get for the price is amazing, and I'd have no problem recommending this to somebody who is interested in a starter uke, especially because it comes with a bag and a really great tuner. The bag is pretty basic and I might someday upgrade to a more padded bag, but it's not an awful bag, either.If you're interested in learning, or if you have a kid who is interested, this is a sure bet. It's not up to the standards of a professional instrument, but you're gonna have a hard time beating this for the price.
name: Ben M.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
content: Lovely little uke. probably a 4.5 as a starter. I bought it for my soon to be 6 year old because she wants one like mine. The wood tone is a beautiful, medium mahogany. The strap is quite nice (especially if you like orange, black, and white which are my college colors). The case could be finished with a softer fabric, but at least it is well padded and the dark fabric doesn't show stains. But the real winner is the uke itself. The tone when in tune is very nice, but the strings that come with it are not very good. They stretch much faster than the Aquila nylgut strings I have on my other ukuleles. Thus, it will not stay in tune as shipped. I switched to a spare set of strings and it worked much better. Ultimately, the plan is to change the strings to a special order set of Aquila fifths strings so that it is tuned like my mandolin, allowing her to learn fingerings while her fingers grow to accommodate the double strings of the mando.Please note, all ukulele strings need to stretch so it often takes a week or two before it will hold a note reliably. That said, the fluoro-carbon strings that ship with this uke don't keep tune for more than 5 minutes. Do yourself a favor and order a set of nylgut strings. I've never had a problem with them that wasn't user error.
name: Schillil

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
content: This is an excellent ukulele for beginners.  It's probably from a generic Chinese manufacturer that sells under several company names, but it's been great for me.  My music teacher was impressed with the sound and quality at this price.  It stays in tune for quite a while with only minor adjustments every few days. I find the strap to be very helpful for standing while playing.  The case has backpack style straps, which is nice for walking or biking to music class. Comes with an extra set of strings and a decent tuner. This is all you need to start playing the uke.  The Concert size is a good choice if you aren't sure about which one to buy, but larger hands will appreciate the Tenor size.

content: This is a great Ukulele for beginners. I would say it is definitely worth the price. This Ukulele is definitely worth the value for anyone interested in learning to play. Some of my friends have more expensive Ukuleles ($200+) and you can visually see and feel a difference in the quality of the wood but there is really no reason that this Ukulele wouldn't work well for any novice player. It does it's job, and it does it's job well.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2017
content: The Donner soprano Ukulele Mahogany DUS-1 21 inch ukulele seems to be a good buy for the money.  It was bought as a Christmas present for my grand-daughter, and I am sure she will be well pleased.  It has a very nice full tone, is made of wood rather than plastic, and has metal gears for tuning which help to keep the strings from constantly going out of tune., All this makes the Uk much more than just a toy.  It comes with almot everything a beginner would need: case, straps, tuner and extra strings.  At first I had trouble tuning it; the instructions that came with the tuner were not clear to me. The strings are labeled  1,2,3, and 4, and I thought 1 referred to the lowest string (G), when 1 really refers to the highest string (A).  Once I figured out my mistake I really enjoyed working with the tuner which makes tuning easy, fast, and foolproof.  The only thing that would make this gift a little better is a short beginner's book on playing the Uk.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
content: I've been shopping for a ukulele for awhile and this cyber Monday deal just couldn't be passed up. The reviews are true; this is a cool ukulele. I wasn't sure whether to purchase the concert or tenor but opted for the tenor and am glad I did. The 26 inch size is PERFECT for me and so comfortable to hold. Nice construction and smooth finish. The fret board is nice and wide, but not too wide. It's going to take a bit of time to stretch the strings and I will probably change them out for a better set. The extras like the tuner and case are decent. I would recommend this as a solid starter ukulele for anyone. It's a small investment for a very fun hobby of making some music for yourself, family and friends.

name: iloveflowers

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
content: We've bought a couple of Donners. I have large hands and these ukuleles have 1.5" nuts, that means they have a WIDE fret board.It makes sopranos and concerts very playable for adult men.Quality is more that acceptable, its great. Nicely finished and it includes nice details. The Bridge is a slot, which, makes string changes quick and easy,Side dots on the fret board? Yep, got um.The Action (string height above the fret board) was high and needed to be adjusted. This isn't a big chore, a cheap string gauge and a little sand paper fixes things in a few minutes. YouTube is your friend!But how is the sound? That's what we really care about.These Ukuleles sound great!Seriously, they are loud, and have great 'bark'.I like to string them with Martin Flouro carbon 600's. This is the time to adjust the action.Some folks like Nyguts, which are personal preference.I recommend these instrument.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2017
short_d: You will not find a better value. My friend recently bought a similarly priced ...
content: You will not find a better value.  My friend recently bought a similarly priced uke from another brand and you could see the envy on his face as he inspected my instrument.  First the sound is great for such an inexpensive uke.  The tuning begs are pretty and once the strings have been played on for a while (nylon strings will lose tuning for a while) it holds tune for a while.One of the main aspects that my ukelele has that is superior to my friend's is the slightly larger fret board.  It makes getting your fingers to the proper chords much easier than on his.The tuner is great!  The display turns a nice bright green when you are in tune.  And you can set it to Guitar, and Violin as well as the Ukelele.  Having a strap and the strap nuts already installed seals the deal.  This is a GREAT value!
name: Steven Kintop

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2017
content: I have been nothing but pleased with this purchase. For the price, the ukelele is very well made, and all the extras make this a good deal (kit bag, extra set of strings, strap, and tuner.) Some folks have complained that it needs to be retuned a lot, but honestly that is not at all unusual for a new stringed instrument. After a couple of weeks of playing, I found this one held its tune pretty well. It's easy to play, and there are so many videos online showing how to learn songs it has been a lot of fun. I wasn't about to spend a lot of money on something I wasn't sure I would enjoy, but this has been really fun. If you are considering buying a ukelele for the first time I really recommend this one.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2017
content: I bought this uke on a whim after reading the reviews here and elsewhere.  And I'm very glad I did.  I got it yesterday and I haven't been able to put it down for very long.  It sounds fantastic even with the stock strings.  I wonder how much better it would sound with Aquila strings... The frets are nice and smooth.  The body is well made and although there is some visible glue along the side joints, you can't feel them.  I can't say it's loud or punchy but it's got a real nice even tone, which I prefer.  The fit and finish is very nicely done.  There's nothing bad I can say about this uke other than the fretboard will need to get some dressing done as it looks dry and maybe polish the frets.I had purchased the Cordoba 20TM ($155) before this but returned it because the G was very muddy sounding and the fret ends were not smoothed very well.  The overall build of this Donner is way better than the Cordoba which was very surprising for a uke that half as much as the Cordoba and  comes with all the extra stuff!  Sounds better too!

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2017
short_d: Overall, impressive starter ukulele and awesome impulse buy
content: I'm really enjoying this ukulele after a month of ownership. The quality is great for what you pay, and what you get. Build quality and material essentially meet the standards for pricing. I anticipated having an issue with this useless holding a tune, but I am surprised how well it holds a tune now. Initially my top two strings held a tune well, while the bottom two would go out between a day or two break of playing. I break it out once or twice every few days since buying it a month ago, requiring only minor adjustments utilizing the tuner that came with the ukulele. After about a month of regular use and adjustments, I find it still holding a tune for a few days now, surprisingly. I assume the strings are "broken in" at this point. The tuner that comes with is also great, very straightforward, and hasn't given me any issues. I also really like the case for peace of mind and storage. The soprano is a little small, as expected, and I anticipate buying a concert size from the same manufacturer so I can negotiate my fingers well enough to play a few songs I want to learn. Overall I am beyond satisfied in the realm  of cost and quality for everything I got. I would definitely recommend for anyone curious enough to start playing without wanting to make a major investment.
name: Chris and Andrea

Very sturdy, well made, high-quality! It has a beautiful tone, and seems to stay in tune.  The wood is beautiful, too. The case that comes with it is well made, protective, and has a nice large storage area. It also comes with extra strings, a decent strap, and a tuner that works great. We bought this along with the Essential Elements for ukelele book for our daughter, and she was able to teach herself and can now play pretty well!

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2017
short_d: Good package at a fair price.
content: I have had this ukulele for a few months now and I am not sorry I purchased it. This is my first ukulele, but I have had guitars for years, and I wanted a ukulele to tinker with.On opening the package, all that was described was included... Good start so far. The ukulele was in good shape with no shipping damage and no factory blemishes. In fact, the ukulele is very nice looking. The soft case is also quite nice and seems like it will hold up with use. The ukulele strap is on the cheap end and easily twists and curls, but I don't use it anyway. If I were going to, I would buy a new one. The ukulele itself did have a couple of rattles - one in the main body and one at the tuning knobs. The rattle in the main body turned out to be a small piece of card stock that must have made its way in during manufacturing and was easily removed by giving the ukulele a couple of shakes with the hole facing down. The rattle on the tuning knobs ended up being a loose nut at the base of one of the string posts; a couple of turns with a small open-end wrench and the ukulele is rattle free.Over the first couple weeks, the ukulele needed frequent tuning. This is to be expected with new nylon strings as they have some give in them and will stretch and also since they are tied at the bottom with knots and the knots will tighten with the tension and loosen up the strings. Once all this settled, it only requires occasional minor tuning and sounds great. This ukulele is a pleasure to play and all the notes are clean with no string rattles or dead spots like you might find on a cheaper instrument. I have kept this ukulele out and laying around and it survived the destructive forces of my children so far.The tuner that comes with this package has now replaced the more expensive tuner I have been using for my guitars for years. It is very simple and works well.Bottom line is, if you are looking for a ukulele to learn on, tinker with, or play around the campfire, but don't want to spend a lot of money, this package is definitely worth the price (I paid $69.00). I would definitely recommend this product. If you have larger hands, you may want to consider the tenor size instead.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2017
content: I've had the soprano version for a little over 24 hours now. I've been playing it a lot. Verdict: I love it.I'm a fingerstyle guitar player for 20 years now. I've had a tenor uke (a Cordoba) for about four years. The amount of time I spend on my various musical instruments tends to go up and down. Lately I've spent much time on the ukulele. Blues, ragtime, medieval, renaissance, classical.I got this soprano so that I would have something small to take on an upcoming vacation.First, the tuning: many people report huge problems keeping it in tune. I don't question their experience. But 24 hours in, I have to tweak the tuning maybe once every 15 minutes of playing. It has stabilized very quickly.Fit and finish. I'm not going to tout this as a high-end instrument. The fretboard is a bit rough looking in one spot above the 12th fret. That's the only complaint I have. The instrument looks good, has no sharp edges. Very nice. Also, no fret buzz whatsoever, anywhere on the neck. This is what worried me the most.Playability: For a soprano, very good. The neck is quite a bit wider than my Cordoba, making me think I will probably order the tenor version of this uke at some point. It just plays nice.  Smooth and easy and inviting. I'm still adjusting to playing such a small instrument, but after just 24 hours, I've already made a lot of progress along that line.Tone: Again this is not a professional instrument, and I am by no means a professional player.  But I really like how it sounds. Any soprano will have a thinner sound than a tenor, but this one rings out nicely and has an almost banjo-like tone to my ears. I like that. I like being able to switch from this to the tenor and get such a dramatic change in tone. This one doesn't sound cheap or toy-like to my ears; just different, in a good way.Will update this review after my vacation, during which I will spend much, much time playing it. But so far, it's really hard to believe that the purchase price got me not only the ukulele, but a very nice bag (with shoulder straps!), a strap, an extra set of strings, and a very nice little clamp-on tuner. If I had paid twice the price for just the ukulele, I would still be very pleased.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2017
content: This is a great little instrument for the price (prime day sale item) and it exceeded my expectations. Unlike other reviewers, I found that after a little time stretching, tuning and playing this ukulele it holds its tune quite well (even with the original strings). I purchased the concert size and it has a nice crisp and louder than expected sound. It comes with everything you need to get started (except picks) with everything individually packaged and in perfect condition.HOWEVER, as a guitar player of 21 years, I have become accustomed to a higher quality instrument. I purchased this ukulele to learn a new instrument without breaking the bank before knowing if I will stick to it. This is a great beginner instrument but I will quickly out grow it. The wood has a few ugly flaws that may bother other players but I will happily pass off as "character" and there is a dent in the first fret that luckily is positioned where it does not effect sound or playability. The action is off as the bridge sits high and the saddle is slightly crooked (again, a non seasoned musician will not notice or be bothered by this) and one of the tuning knobs is stiff. I will personally address these issues the first time I re-string.So why the 5 star review with the above issues? For the price, this is a great deal and I am very happy with my purchase. I believe it was priced appropriately for what I got and will get me comfortably on my way to learning a new instrument. I would recommend this product for all new beginners.

short_d: If The Thunder Don't Get You, Then the Lightning Deal Will
content: For as cheap as this was, I'd expect less but got a little more.Pros:-sounds great for the price-did I mention the price was beyond fair (:)-comes with tuner, straps, case, etc. (all-in-one starter kit basically)Cons:-needs lots of adjustment tuning (more than the usual and likely due to cheap, less pliable materials)-materials are not incredibly resilient so you have to be careful and store this properly-made in China (not trying to be an isolationist or ethnocentric here, just not a fan of unfettered environmental destruction, poor labor conditions, unfair wages, and large carbon footprints--all things that come with buying cheap Chinese products in America)Conclusion: I carry some guilt buying this for reasons described above but it was incredibly cheap and fit all my requirements so I bought it anyway. Thus far, I am not disappointed in terms of sound, price/value, and overall relative quality.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2017
content: My review of four stars is meant to denote that this is a better-than-average product for what it is, NOT that this is a better-than-average sounding ukulele.It simply isn't a good enough sounding ukulele to earn five stars, but it's probably better quality than what you'd expect for the price ($75 when I got it). If this were a ukulele company's review site, this would be a three star uke: a little thin sounding, not the best tuning hardware, but keeps in tune fine and no buzzy frets. Sits fine in the room when playing with acoustic instruments. A good beginner's uke. But, because this is an Amazon review of some random cheap uke from Donner (who I think of as a pedal company), and I got a case, strap, extra strings, and a tuner all for $75/shipped, and it plays pretty well, it deserves the extra star.I actually got two, and gave one to my son, who also enjoys jamming on it once-in-a-while.

name: Amazon Customer

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
content: I bought this on Prime Day 2017 and couldn't be happier with it. It is more beautiful than the pictures, a deeper caramel color, which I tried to capture in the photo. The mahogany grain is beautiful and shimmers as the light changes, enhanced by a subtle satin finish. The tone is rich and resonant. The body is fairly large for a concert, which opens up the volume. The back is slightly curved. The Donner logo is inlaid into the headstock. The tuning gears work smoothly and hold their position, with pegs similar in color to the mahogany. The nut is a full 1.5" wide, which makes it easier for people with larger-sized fingers to play. The frets are level and beveled on the sides for comfort, and the fret ends are covered. I haven't had any problems with strings buzzing. There are side position markers in addition to those on the fretboard. The saddle is compensated for consistent intonation. The slotted bridge makes it very easy to change the strings. Strap buttons are already installed. While the rope rosette is not flashy, there are some nice stylistic touches in the shapes of the bridge and the end of the rosewood fretboard.I noticed that the nut on mine was a little high on one side due to a glue defect. I popped it off with a pocket knife and scraped the glue off, then sanded the underside of the nut just a little to lower the action. This is something I wouldn't have dared to do myself to a more expensive instrument. (Caution: If you try this, be very careful you don't go too far and cause a buzz.) In terms of balance, it's a little neck-heavy, but it's not something you'd notice if you use a strap.In terms of the accessories, the bag is well-padded, with an outside zipper pocket for accessories and clip-on shoulder straps. All new strings take while to settle in, so it's great for tuning to be as easy as possible. I liked the Donner tuner so much, I bought additional ones (Donner DT-2) for each of my other ukuleles. The included strap is lightweight and narrow, but it works. The extra strings are nice. I see the kit now comes with flat plastic picks; you won't need those -- ukuleles are generally played with the fingers, or rarely with a felt pick.After buying it, I noticed it was the top-rated concert-sized ukulele in the online The Wirecutter review of the best ukuleles for beginners. Of course, you won't mistake it for a $500 solid-wood ukulele, but it's an amazing value for the price, and you can take it anywhere without worry. I bought a hard case for it (the Musician's Gear concert ukulele case fits it like a glove) and packed it in my suitcase for a recent plane trip. It came through fine.Update: After playing it for about 5 months, I changed the strings to Aquila Super Nylgut. The sound became significantly louder, if not quite as sweet to my ear. 5 months later, I changed to Aquila Sugar strings. Now it is really bright and loud, with a lot of projection and sustain. For the first time, in a group of 20 strummers, I can always hear myself play. The Sugar strings settle in pretty fast, but be forewarned, they do squeak when you pluck them, rather like wound strings. This gets better with time but doesn't entirely go away. The string maker recommends using hand lotion on your hands to minimize the squeaking.Second Update: Today after a couple of months with the Aquila Sugar strings, I replaced them with Martin M600 flurocarbon strings, and I really like them. There was something about the sugars that sounded just a little odd, a little artificial. The Martins have a clear bell-like tone that is equally loud as the sugars but sounds more natural. Of course, string choice is a matter of personal preference, but I'm really happy with the Martins. Martin M600s are smaller in diameter than the sugars and less stretchy than some strings, so they may seem a bit harder to your fingertips at first, as flurocarbons generally do. But they give a brilliant, rich tone.Third Update: I liked the Martin strings, but I became frustrated by flaws in the intonation. Switched the strings again, and this time it's the fantastic. Fremont BlackLine Mediums are thin black fluorocarbon strings. They give it amazing clarity, volume, resonance and sustain, and the intonation is near perfect all the way up the neck. I was thinking of upgrading to a solid wood instrument to take my playing to the next level, but now I'm not sure I need to. It looks so sleek with it's ebony strings that I gave it an elegant new strap befitting the look.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
content: Giving this ukulele as a gift to my granddaughter.  I have a tenor ukulele (larger) and consider myself new to ukuleles, playing only a year or so.  But I have to say how impressed I am with the sound of the Donner.  It is rich and warm.  Fit and finish is beautifully done albeit somewhat plain.  It was totally out of tune after delivery, and it took a lot of turnings to get the strings close, but after a day of tuning and playing it seems to be staying in tune well.  The padded case is nice but just slightly undersized......but it does fit.  The zippers are short and you need to insert the bottom first.  The strap is only OK (but the installed strap pegs are perfect and a big plus).  The Donner tuner takes some getting used to.  It is versatile in that it includes guitar and other instruments, it gives sharps and flats indications and the screen turns green when you're in tune.  Very nice. The extra strings are a plus. Also adding new strings appears to be easier than normal as there are slotted string lines instead of just holes where you insert and tie and lock normal ukulele strings.  Bonus on that design.  Overall and for the money spent, this is nearly a perfect way to start playing ukulele.

It's more suited for a concert size.The included tuner got the uke tuned so much faster than any app I have tried before. date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
content: This is my first uke, so I'm no expert, however, I've owned my fair share of guitars over the years, so I can recognize quality craftsmanship in an instrument. The materials and hardware used in this ukulele feels really nice, and the overall construction and finish is - as far as I can tell - absolutely perfect. I have to say, I'm really surprise just how nice it is, given the price. As a musical instrument, the action is nice and low without any buzz, the fretboard feels good (no sharp edges on the frets), and the sound has a great balance of warmth and brightness. Very easy to play. I absolutely love the Donner tuner (it has replaced my others for guitar), and the case, strap and other bundled items are just great. I'm delighted with this ukulele, and more than happy to recommend it to anyone.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2017
short_d: 10 year guitar player - "If you're looking for a good quality ukulele to start on, this product is for you!"
content: Wanted a cheap uke, could have got a Kala but I gave Donner a chance mostly because it came with a sweet gigbag. I must say as a 10 year guitar player, this ukulele is well put together. It plays great, holds a tune VERY well. I even left it in my car in the heat for a few hours *don't do this at home* to see if the any expansion and contraction of the wood would cause it to lose some tune. I found after, using the chromatic tuner THAT COMES INCLUDED showed it to be in near perfect tune. Best value ukulele in my opinion. I really enjoy playing it. Ask anyone I work know, my uke and I are attached at the hip. I've learned 10+ songs so far and it's been a month. This is a great instrument for any beginner or an advanced player. The strings are much more comfortable to play as opposed to the steel strings on a guitar. If you're looking for a good quality ukulele to start on, this product is for you!

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2017
content: I love my ukulele. It is not a high-end instrument, but I didn't want one until I learned how to play well. The sound is actually very nice, and I've taken it camping, where I  encountered someone who knows a thing or two about ukuleles. He actually said he wanted to try my instrument and was very surprised at the sound, and felt like it was a top notch beginner instrument.  Even though I'm determined to become a  superb ukulele player, and someday plan on getting an expensive ukulele, I suspect that this will be my favorite traveling instrument.  I love that it stays in tune for me,  and I am very happy with all the extras it came with.  UPDATE:  I haven't even been playing for half a year yet, but I am making great progress, and recently went to the music store to get a capo. I tried out all their concert ukuleles,  and there was not a single  beginning ukulele that sounds as good as this one. Some of the $200 ukuleles  didn't even have as nice of a tone.  I might be a beginner ukulele player, but I have been playing music for my whole life. I like to think I know a thing or two about what sounds good, and I really like the sound of this instrument.

short_d: I had struggled with spending more on a Tenor from a Hawaii brand but did not want to spend that much on something that I may no
content: This is my first Ukulele. I went with the DUC-1 model (concert size) because of information that I had gathered off of the internet. I had struggled with spending more on a Tenor from a Hawaii brand but did not want to spend that much on something that I may not enjoy doing. The Uke arrived from UPS with no damage. There was an outer box with paper surrounding the inner box that contained the Uke which was in it's gig bag. I found no damage or flaws in the Uke and the color was pleasant a little rosier in color than my solid mahogany Dulcimer. The Uke was naturally out of tune with the strings loose (interesting that part of the care card stated for long term storage to loosen strings to prevent warping). I tuned the Uke with the included tuner and also one I had on hand. So far I have tuned it about a half dozen times as the strings stretch. The sustain is good and the sound is pleasant. The only thing that I do not like is the balance. I will use a strap and the included strap fits well but when you let go of the Uke it goes neck down because of the weight. Donner did include a cord with the strap to tie one end at the neck. This will prevent the balance issue for me. Since I just inboxed and started playing this is not a long term review. I am very happy with my choice and hope to get many hours of play as I learn.

One string popped off during this; it seems like they just have a knot at the end and it slipped off under pressure. I tied a figure eight that won't slip and it's stayed on fine since. date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2017
short_d: "That is mahogany!" - me to some plebe in the near future
content: I wanted to wait awhile to post this review, but I'm honestly too excited about it so I'm just gonna do it now. I am an ABSOLUTE beginner, I've never played a string instrument...or any instrument. With the exception of the recorder in the 4th grade along with the rest of America, the purpose of which will one day reveal itself, I'm sure.Anyway. I'm a musical-beginner, so take what I have to say with a grain of salt, but this ukulele seems great for someone at my skill level (- 5). It was easy to tune (I'm keeping the strings it came with for now, but I may switch them to the Aquila ones I purchased along with this ukulele once I find an easy-to-follow tutorial for replacing uke strings)..The sound is sweet and I've been plucking at it for about a week now. It does need to be tuned quite often, but I'm aware that this is true for all (most?) new ukes/strings and this will hopefully improve with time.The packaging was solid and all the advertised components were included. There was nothing wrong (either aesthetically or otherwise) with the ukulele itself and the finish on it is beautiful. I actually really loved the smell of it too, which is probably weird, but it just smells like fresh mahogany. A side benefit of this uke-choice is that a whole world of "That is mahogany!" jokes are now open to me.Speaking of side benefits, the extras that came with this uke are great - the bag is nice and padded, the tuner is easy enough for a noob like myself to use, and the strap has already proven itself to be useful.I'm glad I chose this ukulele and look forward to gaining even more hipster street cred with it in the future. :)
