date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2017
short_d: sorry for the bad pun. ) Honestly
content: As a 50-something woman, I've secretly longed to play the uke for years but felt time and ability to learn had passed me by.  Not so, thanks to my new Donner ukele!  After researching online, I opted for this low-priced model that came equipped with tuner and carrying case.  Thank god for that as, knowing nothing, I would never have ordered a tuner.  Without that little baby, my 'career' would have ended after the first frustrating 20 minutes.  With the tuner and a week of practice, I'm strum patterning and chording to beat the band.  (OK, sorry for the bad pun.)Honestly, after one week and some amazing websites, I'm confident and fairly competent on a range of songs, from the ever-expected Somewhere Over the Rainbow to Hallelujah to You're So Vain to Jolene to I'm Yours.  True to my research info, I spent more time tuning the uke than trying to learn anything the first two days.  Now, after a week, my uke stays in tune from day to day and I just have to check to make sure it's still ready to play.Now if only I could get my fingertips to callous as easily as the ukulele learned to stay in tune.......

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2017
short_d: I'm a UKE NEWBIE, and this instrument is AWESOME!!!
content: I've been wanting a ukulele all winter. I'm a 67 year old lady who has played guitar for a few decades. Totally self-taught, and strictly a chord strummer. I'd put off ordering a ukulele, but a week ago, when I asked my daughter in law what I should get my soon-to-be granddaughter for her birthday, she said, "She's been wanting a ukule for so long!"  So, I took the plunge, and last week I ordered TWO of these Donner Concert Ukeleles... one for my granddaughter and one for myself.My granddaughter has never had any formal training on musical instruments. A few years ago I taught her a couple of chords on the guitar but that's it. When I gave her the uke I had printed out the chords to a few popular songs I knew she liked and showed her the basics. 24 hours later she came up to my house and I was stunned at how well she was playing these songs! I, too, found it quite easy to learn to play the thing, although it took my brain a bit longer to "re-learn" how to play chords on the uke as they were totally different than the guitar. But she and I were playing duets!Our 37 year old daughter was visiting today. She wanted me to play a song on the uke. I did, and she wanted to try. She had piano lessons as a kid and nothing more. I showed her a few chords and within a half hour she was easily playing Vance Joy's "Riptide." She was so excited and wanted to get a uke of her own, so I ordered a THIRD one of these today.As for the uke... the case it came in is very nice. Comes with an extra set of nylon strings and also a digital uke tuner, which can also tune a guitar, banjo, bass, and a few other stringed instruments.The uke itself was the perfect size. I couldn't imagine trying to play the smaller soprano size, and I didn't want  bigger one since I have a bigger acoustic guitar.When first tuning the uke, you might find it easier to use a keyboard to make sure you're getting those loose nylon strings on the correct octave. If you don't have a keyboard, you can find videos on youtube that will help you tune it. After you get them in tune the first time, it becomes much easier using the digital tuner. When you first start playing you'll have to be retuning those strings every few minutes, to get the "stretch" out of them. I found that after two days of playing, the strings stayed in tune much better than the first day.I love the sound of it. It's nicely made and an all-round FUN little instrument to play!The only thing negative is a very minor one... the directions that come with the digital tuner are so small you'd need a jeweler's loop or good magnifying glass to read them. I had to put the sheet on my scanner and blow it up 150% and copy it so I could actually read the thing! Since I had no experience with a digital tuner, it was essential to read the directions. However, as stated earlier, you can get help with this at youtube if you're new to them.So now Grandma, daughter, and granddaughter are hooked on this ukulele. Looks like there'll be some fun times around the campfires this summer!

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2017
short_d: Great buy and good quality...everything you need
content: Understand that I'm reviewing this from the perspective of a beginner ukulele player, but I love this ukulele package. I played guitar previously, so I do have a little experience with stringed instruments (although the uke is very different - in a good way). The ukulele itself is nicely made. The wood grain is beautiful, with a satiny finish. It has a lovely, mellow sound. I play with a felt pick, which I feel also enhances the tone. As other reviewers noted, you have to tune the ukulele a LOT at first. After a week, I'm only tuning the G and A strings a wee bit each time I use it. The tuner is very easy to use, just make sure you have it on the "ukulele" setting! I love that it's really small and unobtrusive. I just leave it attached at the head and fold it down after I've tuned. The strap is a nice add-on. I haven't used it yet, but probably will at some point. Finally, you get an extra set of strings. I know nothing about uke strings, so I can't tell you if they are good ones or not, but I know from playing guitar that it's always good to have an extra set of strings on hand. The bag is nicely padded, and everything fits great in the front zip pocket. It's got two straps so you can put it on backpack style.I looked at a lot of ukuleles, and this seemed to be the best value for a good quality instrument with a lot of accessories. I'm very happy with it, and having a blast learning to play such a happy instrument. There are a ton of tutorials and lessons on YouTube, and you can find a lot of songs that have been adapted to the ukulele. I've learned 5 chords, and I'm working on my first song (The Tide is High, as done by Blondie). So much fun! I highly recommend this uke package. Happy strumming!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2017
content: I bought the 21" version for my cat since it was not too much more expensive than a toy guitar. It is quite small. The ukulele is nicely finished and it comes with a case, strap, tuner, and extra strings. My cat will play any stringed instrument with his claws or teeth.He also plays an electric guitar and an old acoustic that I found by a dumpster. Those have metal strings so I worried about his dental health. The nylon strings and smaller size of this ukulele make it a perfect replacement. Ukulele tuning is also more melodious on the open strings so his music sounds better, like wind chimes.The tone of the ukulele is all right, considering the body is around the size of a cigar box. It will need to be tuned a little each time prior to playing, though the strings might relax later. The action of the strings is easy. Playing harmonics on such short strings is difficult. When I play, I finger-pick, but I think most ukuleles are played with a felt pick, which is not included. This is one way that Donner could improve the product.I'd recommend this ukulele to anyone who needed a little one.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2017
content: This is a very nice Concert size (23") Ukulele. The fit and finish are excellent, though some may not fully appreciate the satin type finish. It produces a nice tone and was loud for a small laminate instrument. I'm not a primary Uke player but from an instrument standpoint this seems like it would be a little workhorse. I had to lower the saddle a bit (1/8 inch) but I'm particular about my set up. The factory set up from the box was certainly playable. I think the biggest improvement that could be made would be better tuning machines, but at this price point they are sufficient and seem to hold tune well once the strings have settled in. I also like the strap buttons, being a mandolin and guitar player it just feels right to use a strap with a Uke, most that I've seen don't include strap buttons so that was a nice feature. Overall it's a five star Ukulele for a beginner to intermediate player.

short_d: Tuner doesn't work for one of two ukuleles ordered
content: Tuner doesn't work for one of two ukuleles I ordered. They are great with a digital readout showing the chord that is currently tuned on the string and as you get closer to F for example it will show an F while a pointer centers on the meter. Finally when you hit F, the meter turns green and you know it is tuned. Unfortunately, my tuner was defective.  Luckily my sister and I both got one, so I used hers.  Except for that they were very nice with a pretty little strap for the uke and a case with a strap for it. I hate to send the whole package back for a tiny little part.  Will wait a few days to see if seller responds to this and then if not, return it all.  Except for the tuner, I would have rated it higher.

name: Lorenda Hurst

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2016
short_d: Affordable and surprisingly well built and playable
content: I have been playing guitar for about 8 years, and I tent to always get very nice high end instruments since normally "you get what you pay for" applies for them. This is my first Ukelele and my children like to play around with instruments as well, so I decided to give this a shot since I didn’t want to pay a lot for something that the kids might be rough with. All I got to say is AMAZING!The look of it is simply super high end, tough it is not solid wood it looks just as if it was all mahogany. Beautifully built.SOUND: Very clear and nice resonance from the woods which plays very well with an acoustic guitar in terms of volume. It is little, but puts out a nice warm yet Ukulele like crisp highsSTRINGS: I have kept the ones that are on and they do match the additional ones that they sent out (which is really cool), again not a Ukulele pro, however the strings are holding up very well and after the first week of playing and stay in tune quite wellBODY: For this price, SUPERB! It is solid built and I can tell it will also take on some beating for a while. The neck is beautiful with a satin finish which makes nice to slide back and forth as you playTUNERS: These in combination with the strings that it comes with have worked super well to keep the instrument in tune for days at a time only minor adjustments every other day, and good to go.PLAYABILITY: Right out of the box this Ukulele feels very smooth around the fretboard, the frets are well polished and do not catch your fingers, the back of the neck allows for easy position change.BAG: Sturdy, extra pocket with zippers for any accessories you might want to carry (tuners, strings, pics, etc.), and it has two shoulder straps sot that you can wear it like a backpack. Nice!EXTRAS: in most cases the “bundles” are a combination of a few cheap items along with the main Item just to catch attention. Not the case here, the tuner (of the same brand as the guitar) works super well, and the plus is that it can be used for any string/vibration instrument. I haven’t used the extra set of strings, but if they are the same as the ones that came installed, I am in good shape. The strap as a really nice pattern and works very well, it can even be adjusted to fit a smaller child.If fits right in with our instrument collection.If you are looking for a starting instrument with an affordable price and that you can actually play. In my opinion that is it.p.s. I did not get this guitar for free from the manufactured (paid $55 for it), and I am not affiliated with Donner, just enjoy good music and nice instruments.

content: Just received the Donner concert uke today. Shipping was very fast and well packed. Add to that that you get an entire kid, tuner, bag, spare strings, straps etc.  the case is lovely and can strap on the back (adult or child) just like a backpack.  its compact, neat and just super.  I'm delighted i bought it. I'm teaching  myself to learn and then going to give this to my 8 year old niece who wants to learn but figure it will help if i can learn it first then help her :)  She's a lefty and the book actually explains how to handle the instrument if you are a lefty.  I'm delighted with this. It was shipped well packaged (big box with air bubbles around its own box and then everything was in another box in the box!  Can't go wrong - worth paying a little extra to get better quality instrument, better strings and a much easier tuning machine - delighted with this - great seller and great price!!

name: Lynda Nelson

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2016
content: This little buddy was actually an impromptu purchase, and being vacationing in Hawaii and seeing this deal at $60 shipped, sealed it's fate to be shipped to me. This is a very reasonable set - although I don't know about ukes much, in 30 minutes I was playing 'Losing my Religion' which incidentally seems to be in the right key for the uke. Anyway, few tech details:- Gig bag is nice and well-padded, very reasonable and good-looking, good pocket;- Tuner is simple and does the job, however buzzes when clipped onto the uke, so I keep it off;- Body is actually mahogany, from what it seems, and not veneer, it's solid wood albeit very thin;- Nicely done rosette, and generally cleanly built, and good looking while rather simple;- Finish is satin, and I prefer it that way - Mahogany has large pores, and this wood has been prepped reasonably well;- Frets are not dressed at a pro level, but they don't catch skin as someone mentioned, I guess that varies; for me it would have been no biggie to polish the edges off if they were rough, but actually for me that works so far;- Actual natural cattle bone nut and saddle;- Easy-loading bridge, kudos...===================================Update: yeah... I did have to go in and file off and round up the edges on frets. Use good sticky polyamide tape to protect the wood, use very tough but somewhat flexible material for the sanding block (I used a good sized eraser) and about 500-grit paper. Worked for me.Now..  nice sound, actually :) I'll be playing this baby a lot!

name: Patricia M. Whiting

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2016
content: While there are a lot of ukuleles available in a wide variety of price ranges on Amazon, if you're looking for a fairly-decent entry-level instrument, this li'l guy is a pretty good value. It is very nicely constructed with smooth mahogany plywood (body) and smooth, nicely interfaced mahogany blocks (neck, neck base [where the neck joins the body] and tuning section), and rosewood fret board and bridge. The primary thing that sold me was this ukulele's consistent intonation as you move up the fret board. The sound is full-bodied and resonant for the instrument's size. The wood finish is not "shiny" per se (i.e., it's unvarnished / unlacquered), but it's nevertheless nice and smooth -- not rough to the touch at all. The curved sides have a nice iridescent quality; the wood pattern shifts as you turn the instrument in the light. Construction is qualitative all the way around - the right-angle-joined edges are all just as smooth as can be and all of the non-wood fittings are cleanly and smoothly joined. The strap pegs are a nice touch, the plastic tuning pegs are perfectly fine and the tuning gears are protected under clear plastic.The logo-embroidered large-front-pocketed bag is surprisingly substantive and the included tuner, strap and strings make the entire package quite a deal. (I did have an issue with the G string buzzing a bit on the 1st fret but settled the issue with the seller.) I keep this ukulele nearby and keep picking it up to play,practice and learn.
name: Bob Hepburn

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2016
short_d: This is a great package deal and each item is very nice
content: This is a great package deal and each item is very nice. We considered a number of different ukuleles before selecting this one. The quality of the wood and manufacturing on this Donner is noticeable and impressive and, consequently, the sound is rich and warm. We chose the concert size because we're all novices and a broad and sturdy folk, so we needed a little more room. I think the sopranos are about 3" smaller in length.The tuner lights up when you're right on the note. We noticed no sharp edges anywhere; everything really is quality craftsmanship. One other thing to note is that every component related to the pegs is metal and should, therefore, be more durable than the plastic ones we say on a lot of other ukes. We're extremely pleased with this uke and everything in this package and I would recommend to to friends without hesitation.

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2016
short_d: This ukulele is absolutely perfect for a first-time player
content: This ukulele is absolutely perfect for a first-time player! We debated on whether to get this or the starter kit by Kala (for Amazon) and decided on this one because of the attached pins and straps. The straps are a must for a smaller child and since we're not a musically inclined family, we have no idea how to install those pins to attach it - this so convenient! It came with professionally packaged accessories: a strap (design as pictured), extra strings, and a tuner -- all individually packaged in an understated eco-brown with logos. Mine even came with extra arm straps (not pictured, and without a package). The case is much nicer in person and even the brown outer packing was nice. This is part of grandma's Christmas gift for an Elena obsessed granddaughter. Grandma is so impressed! Thank you so much. I am glad I helped my mom pick this one over the others. I highly recommend this!

date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2016
short_d: A little rough in several ways, but decent package.
content: I ordered this with low expectations and was basically got what I expected. The uke was of decent quality and build, the strings are taking time to settle, but I expected after working through the standard stretch phase for new strings. The finish of the wood was slightly rougher than I expected, and definitely not as smooth as the Lanikai and Cordova ukes that I've owned. The included strap and tuner were a nice touch, but that was countered by the poor English in the product tags, which made me wary about the quality.I have one gripe about the tuning pegs - the description listed them as wood, but they are NOT. The tuning pegs are wood colored plastic with a visible seam. It would have been really cool if the pegs matched the description. That false description was my deciding factor for dropping my rating one star.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2016
Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2016
short_d: Affordable, quality ukulele packed with extras! Can't put it down!
content: This is the perfect pack for an aspiring ukulele player or a seasoned veteran! Solidly built, no complaints on quality. Plus it comes with some great extras...backpack gigbag, extra strings, a clip on tuner, and strap. The strap is especially helpful and looks great on the uke. The tuner is worth at least $15 itself, it has many modes from chromatic to guitar, bass to uke. Slim profile and you can fold it down to lay flat on the headstock when not in use. I really like the wood grain aesthetic of this ukulele, as well as the wooden tuning keys. It's a beautiful instrument. I would not hesitate to buy this again as a gift for someone I think might enjoy it. It's really a quality instrument, I've been playing it all night!

Of course it’s not a Koa wood or exotic tone wood ukulele so don’t expect that type of sound. For the money, this is hard to beat!
